Reviews.Title: “Near to termini train station”
Reviews.Author: john32london
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, everyone very friendly and helpful. Hotel less than 5 mins from Termini train station and 2 mins from Opera metro station. Rooms are very clean and quiet, breakfast good (for Italian standards) There's a roof terrace where you can take up your own drinks Most of the main monuments/sites are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly Hotel Columbia”
Reviews.Author: Lesley K
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Rome, we always book this hotel. It is very well situated for all the sights and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, without being in-your-face. Nothing is too much bother for them. The breakfast has a good selection and can easily fill you up for the day. Bedrooms are a good size for Rome hotels and are some of the cleanest we have stayed in. It's always pleasure to return to this hotel time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: IAN_HUGHES
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights here and had a wonderfully comfortable stay. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were well appointed, clean and well maintained. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicki K
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel thats central then this is perfect. Rooms were amazing, staff were so helpful and about a 5 minute walk from train station. We stayed with 3 teenagers and the place was magnificent. We stayed for 7 nights and if travelling to Rome this hotel is a must. Breakfast was included and great - except the bread - not sure why no-one has wholemeal bread??? Remember to eat UNDER the train station

Reviews.Title: “Definitely one to recomment”
Reviews.Author: youdbetterbelizeit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early Jan 2012 and were in a room at the front on the 4th floor (it has 5 floors, the 5th being the roof top bar and breakfast area - there is a elevator/lift). It was very comfortable and clean and the staff were always very helpful and polite. The breakfast was good and plentiful and the location of the hotel is absolutely to visit all the sights of Rome. The train and bus termini is only 5 minutes walk away (turn left out of the hotel). We spent four nights at the hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: B S
Reviews.Content: When we first saw the location of the hotel (close to the main train station - Termini) we wondered about the surrounding area. However, we were very pleased as it turned out. The hotel is lovely and clean, the staff is welcoming and accommodating - the owner takes great pride in providing a gracious experience. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: DocDB888
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I spent 2 nights in late October. This is a very charming boutique hotel with a friendly staff. You will see every detail of how well they take care of you during your stay. It also helps to be close to a Metro- the Piazza Rebublica station.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel near the Termini and public transport”
Reviews.Author: malandbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the hotel with our grandson in a triple room. Bed and Breakfast. Excellent buffet breakfast and an exceptionally clean hotel. The only let down for us was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the bedroom. The reception staff, waiters and chamber maids were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: doctorj6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in this hotel and had a very nice experience. The staff is wonderful. The rooms tend to be a little small, but this seems to be the norm in Rome hotels. The location is good , near the terminal, buses and metro but it is still very quiet. There are good restaurants nearby but the sights are not very near.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: adaryud
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Columbia hotel for 7 nights on october 2011, and it was great. Although it's not located in the center and the room was quite small, it is a very pleasant and cosy hotel, with a great staff, very home-feel alike. Breakfast is great, including coffee, all kinds of bread and pastry, cheese, ham, salami, orange and grapefruit juice, fruits, yogourt, jam, and much more. You need nothing more. The hotel is 3 minutes walk from Piazza Republica - where you can get: the main metro line and Termini station (bus, train, metro). 15 minutes walk south and you are at the coliseum, 20 minutes walk west and you are at Fontana di Trevi. And believe me - the walks are worth it because Rome is beautiful! Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: rosie m
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our two nights here. Staff were very friendly and the room was a good size and clean with AC. We walked every where from here. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hambledon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early October 2011 on a city break holiday. Chose hotel based on price, location and TA reviews. We were NOT disappointed. Location is 5 minutes walk from the front of the Rome Termini station which connects you in 30 minutes to the airport. (But note the Leonardo Express, platform 27, is another 5 - 10 minutes tromp from the automated ticket machines at the front of the station!) The "tourist" sites are spread all over Rome so nowhere is going to be ideal for everywhere - but the main bus station is outside the Termini, so this is perfect to be able to catch a bus or metro and cut your walking down a bit. Hotel has reception and (big) lift on ground floor and breakfast room / lounge / computer on top floor. And best of all the roof terrace. Breakfast can be taken to a table on the terrace and as it was 28c (in October!) when we were there - being outside in the Autumn sun was a good thing. Every member of staff was helpful and smiled a lot. Most spoke very good English. Breakfast was standard fare - but plenty of it. Meats, cheese, bread, croissants, cakes, cereal, fruit, juices and fresh coffee made to order. It was possible to fill up enough to just about avoid a lunchtime meal, which was good as Rome must be one of the most expensive places I have ever been for food and especially drink. Bedroom (Rm 212) was ok, with most of what you expect (flat screen TV). Shower only (no bath) but it was a good powerful one, so didn't bother me. The room has an easy to operate safe - but only just big enough to take an iPad - so a bit on the small side. Only thing lacking in room is a kettle and tea / coffee making facilities, but this is a common European fault. Staff on reception really pleasant, especially the two girls. All the cleaning staff were lovely and the rooms were cleaned and presented very well every day. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Richard441
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbia during the last week of September. We chose this facility due to the prime location (near all public transportation) and due to favorable reviews on Trip Advisor. The location clearly cannot be beat, but we got so much more. The room was quiet, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast on the terrace was a delight each morning. I could speak endlessly about the amenities, but I will focus on the exceptional staff. Shortly after booking the room, I sent an email requesting confirmation. I received a thoughtful response from Eleonora which included a site map, some thoughtful travel advice, and a sincere offer to assist with event bookings and other needs. I instantly felt welcome. On the day of our arrival, we struck out to see the city and were met by the desk staff as we left Columbia. The gentleman suggested we leave our passports with him, for our own good. Being a first-time traveler to Italy, and more than a little suspicious, I declined and kept the passports. A day later we met three US travelers who had just lost their passports to pick-pockets. The staff at Columbia had truly been giving sound and caring advice. Finally, at the close of day 1, I was still struggling with a newly purchased cell phone which simply would not function in Italy. Staff worked with me and, when the phone proved to be inoperable, Eleonora used her own credit card to phone my home in the US to tell family we had arrived safely. So much kindness and consideration...I hated to say goodbye. Everything about this place exceeded expectation. The price was right. The Metro, located a block away, places most of the tourist sites within 10 minute's reach. Wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit far away from major attractions”
Reviews.Author: lilsisbet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit of a walk from the major attractions. However.... the hotel is clean and the rooftop patio is like an oasis. Breakfast is included and is served on the rooftop. There is a fee for the Internet access. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly (they get top marks for the staff). The hotel is close to the train station and subway and while it is convenient it was hard to look past the garbage on the street. We walked to the major attractions and took the subway back from the Spanish Steps - it was easy - 2 stops. I would say this is a basic hotel, no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train so wanted somewhere close to the train station. Hotel Columbia was easy to find. Location was great for subway access too. Very friendly staff. Our room was clean and comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed breakfast on the top floor where there was inside and outside tables. The weather was perfect for starting the day on their garden deck with a breakfast that had a wide variety of good foods. Loved the dishes and great coffee too. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: Upon reception the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was #206 which was spacious with high ceilings although the color and decor is a bit dated. But the cleanliness of the room more than made up for it. We had a fantastic view of the street where there was a great restaurant right across from us (order the pizza with ham an capacolla!). The subway is only about a 5 minutes walk so getting around quickly from this hotel is no problem. A must is the morning rooftop breakfast. Great food and ambience before you hit the city. Overall, I'd consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful terrace over the roofs of Rome”
Reviews.Author: isa_brunelli
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel 2 minutes from the Stazione Termini, nice rooms, wonderful terrace on the roofs where you take breakfast and you can enjoy a drink in the evening. Excellent service: we really appreciated for example the fresh fruits in the room, the quick way to get a taxi from the reception and the kindness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very friendly and comfortable, our ideal holiday...!"”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Hotel Columbia ensured my wife and I enjoyed the perfect holiday in Rome.... Located only 2 minute's walk from Termini, Rome's central bus/railway station, it could not be easier to get to, or to travel around the city during our stay. Also just around the corner, was Via Nazionale, Rome's equivalent of Oxford Street, so we were well and truly right in the heart of the city with a wonderful variety of shops, cafe's, bar's and restaurants in close proximity. That said, the hotel environment was still peaceful and relaxing. We found it easy to walk to many of Rome's most famous attractions, but had the option of an all day bus pass for just 4 Euros. (Our highlight was hiring a Vespa scooter for a 4 hour sightseeing tour, complete with accompanying tour guide - what more stylish a way could one enjoy the eternal city!? 'Bici Baci', the hire company are just a couple of buildings up from the Hotel.) We found our room to be cool and comfortable, we slept very well, and expecially enjoyed the fabulous continental breakfasts, featuring croissants, cold meats and cheeses, fruit, yogarts, sweet pastries, and our favourite coffee or tea, with re-fills, this set us up for the day. The setting was the rooftop balcony restaurant. All the staff were extremely friendly and attentive, giving us sound advice and tending to our every need. - We would love to come back - a wonderful base from which to enjoy the 'Eternal City' to the full.

Reviews.Title: “It was great, we'll be back :)”
Reviews.Author: defborcadillo86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. The room was clean and nicely furnished. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very clean. Our room and the bathroom were cleaned every day. We had breakfast on the roof of the hotel. The selection at the breakfast buffet is very good, it has always tasted. The hotel employee were always very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and we'll definitely be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: megc1990
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. We chose the hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, and everything was better than we expected. Really good hospitality, very personable staff - went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, even packed us breakfast and lunches when we had full day trips outside Rome! We had free breakfast every morning that was good and served on the roof which was nice. Free wifi - it was a little slow, the only real complaint I can come up with. Location is nice, restaurants right across the street and and all along the nearby streets as well. Metro station is a 5 minute walk with luggage - no stairs or anything, so pretty convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: parki6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbia for five nights at the end of July. Choosing this hotel after reading positive reviews on tripadvisor we were not disappointed. Our room was quite small but had everything we needed, the air conditioning worked well and the windows opened onto a shady courtyard. The room and public areas were kept very clean. The buffet breakfast was impressive and offered a good variety of food, this was available on the shady roof terrace. Staff were very friendly and knowlegable about bus timetables and offered advice on how to make the most of our visit to Rome. The hotel is close to the termini and both shops either side of the hotel are empty which gave the impression that the area is a bit run down but once inside its a little haven.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: suzanne_baal
Reviews.Content: We passed through Rome three times during a three-week trip to Italy and stayed in this hotel every time, ranging from 1-3 nights per stay. It was clean and very conveneint and the rooms were nice. Some of the hotel staff remembered us from one visit to the next and were friendly and personable, and others did not and were not generally very friendly. The breakfast was very nice and the roof-top eating area was lovely. The WiFi was included in our rooms, but was a hassle every time - they had to provide a code, and it didn't work properly on the iPhone but did on the BlackBerry and then kept timing out... Some front desk people gave us as many codes as we wanted, and others were cheap with the codes from some mysterious reason. It was a great "home base" for us and although it wasn't cheap it seems reasonable and was nice and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: DollymixOssett
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a Cresta CIty Break. The hotel was clean and comfortable, although the room was quite small. bathroom clean and tidy fresh towels provided each day. The buffet breakfast was excellent served on the roof terrace. This was our first visit to Rome and we managed to see most of the major tourist sites. WE travelled from Fumiciano Airport into Rome on the Leonardo Express this was straight forward to use and took about 30 minutes to Termini Station, the hotel was only 10 minutes walk away. we found the Metro system and buses easy to use costing 1 euro per journey excellent value! Also the hop on off bus was great to give you an idea where the main sites were. We booked tickets to visit the Vatican and Sistine Chapel on-line this worked very well enabling us to by-pass the enormous queues a great relief in 35 degree heat! When we return to Rome we will go in Spring when the heat is not so intense.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD PLACE”
Reviews.Author: guanajo007
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, 3 block from Termini train station The gentleman at the front desk was very nice, gave us many tips about churches, buses, very nice, way above avarage (average in italy is way low comare to the standard in US) We stayed at a suite with 2 floors, kids love the fact they slep uptairs. The room was huge and the hotel is beautiful inside Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “It grew on me, but I wouldn't go back.”
Reviews.Author: lily23Winchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 in their family suite (2 children, 12 and 16). The bedrooms were located on 2 different levels with only 1 extremely small and very basic bathroom between 4 of us. If you are looking for a hotel that becomes your home whilst you are away then I don't think this would be it. The rooms are clean but fairly basic and our roomoverlooked some flats and a grubby, untended courtyard. The staff were lovely, having said all that. So whilst I really didn't like it to begin with, and would look for a more aesthetically pleasing hotel when next in Rome, I feel bad for the staff if I criticise it, it was ok - clean and offered a bed for the night - just no frills. But it just wasn't for us, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be bettered”
Reviews.Author: bribet
Reviews.Content: Family trip for son-in-law's special birthday. Hotel staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. On the actual birthday date went out of their way to make it memorable. Hotel very central to most of the sites which are within walking distance if not to hot. Vatican city requires transport. Can reccomend the "hop-on hop-off" open bus tour. Buses every 20 minutes. Bus station and central rail terminal less than 5 minutes walk away. Hotel very clean and pleasant and breakfast on the roof terrace is very enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the best hotel I've ever had the pleasure to stay in”
Reviews.Author: NicholaV
Reviews.Content: My husbands 40th birthday saw 6 family members (including two pensioners) heading to Rome and staying at the Hotel Columbia. We have all travelled extensively (Monte Carlo to Las Vegas, via The Arctic Circle) and every one of us said the Columbia was without doubt the best customer service we had ever experienced. It is a 3 star hotel in terms of furnishings and room size. It is well beyond 7 star for hospitality, assistance, warm smiles, every request attended to immediately. If ever you go to Rome... this is the ONLY place to stay. Close to the termini, great local facilities (restaurants/supermarkets/access to organised tours); the jewel in the crown is the beautiful roof terrace... breakfast each morning; leisurely drinks out of the 40 degree afternoon heat; and 11pm nightcaps which went on until 1am..... bar prices were very good at the hotel; room service was exceptional.... spotlessly clean; italian lessons thrown in for free; nothing too much trouble. Rome was amazing... staying at the Columbia made it out of this world. Will definitely be returning to the City and this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JimNancyT
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop on a 2 month holiday across Europe, the UK, Ireland and Egypt. We arrive at the hotel in the evening and were greeted by the friendly staff who made check-in painless and showed us up to our room. The room was quaint, cozy, comfortable and clean. Although the room had 2 single bed, we were able to push them together to make a double. The only drawback to the room was the fact that it didn't provide coffee/tea making facilities. The hotel offered a breakfast buffet served from the terrace, with enough variety to satisfy anyone's palate. It was great to get out into the open on the rooftop and enjoy all the treats on offer. We should also note that the buffet was well stocked and topped up regularly as well. The hotel location was great as well as it was within walking distance of many attractions and close to many services (train station, pharmacy, site seeing bus stops, laundromat, etc). All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again upon our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonandPeter
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and to the Hotel Columbia. On arrival we found the staff on reception very friendly and helpful. Our room, although small, was extremely comfortable and clean. The breakfast was brilliant with plenty of choice and again the staff were very pleasant and welcoming. We were pleasantly surprised by how close the hotel was to most of the sights of this fabulous City and we walked everywhere!! The terrace area was ideal for sitting out on an evening enjoying a drink or two!! We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “City tax”
Reviews.Author: clojacks
Reviews.Content: Not realy a review per se, but wanted to provide a retort to those accusing the Columbia of pulling a fast one on the city tax issue. we are curently stating at the Columia post cruising the Mediteranean. We stayed at another Hotel near the vatican for a pre-cruise stay and the tac had to be paid there in Euros as well. I sincerely don't believe the Columbia has any control over this issue. Could it be mentioned in their bookings? Probably. But I don't know how long this tax has been imposed and whether it is a curent issue or not. But, to criticize the Columbia for that issue I feel is misdirected.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: 260690daniel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a 40th birthday present for my husband and it was worth every penny and more. Slap bang in the middle of Rome and round the corner from where you can catch the sight seeing tour bus so no need for the tube. Will stay here again next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, perfect hotel for what I needed.”
Reviews.Author: DSK3some
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days and 2 nights. They let me check in to my room before noon. It was a 3 minute walk from Termini so maybe 10 minutes from exiting train from the airport to being at the hotel. Food, pharmacy, metro, buses, all within easy walking distance. Room was a single bed, good size window, open to a quite courtyard, to let in fresh air, and nice bathroom. The cool tile on the floor saved my exhausted feet after days of sightseeing. Staff was nice, great English with some much needed Italian tutoring, helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not thrilled with staff.”
Reviews.Author: ljk37
Reviews.Content: Easy location, very near Termini Stazione and Piazza del Republica. Very good breakfast and lots of little extras in the room. However, I would have preferred a more comfortable bed and pillows over all the little extras. Rooms were pretty small and beds were hard, but shower wasn't too small. Surprised by all the 'extras' we had to pay for with euros when we got there though...we purchased the Roma pass ahead of time (worth it, by the way if you're doing a lot of sightseeing), however found out when we got there that it was not included on our credit card. Also, we were asked to pay the room and city taxes in euros when we checked out. Those two things really put a cramp in our cash flow.

Reviews.Title: “Charged an extra room tax at the end of the stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fatcat51
Reviews.Content: We found hotel Columbia on Tripadvisor and booked based on the reviews listed. This hotel is well located to Termini Station - 5 minute walk. It is clean and the rooms were nice. The roof garden was lovely and the breakfast included with the room provided you with everything you need to start your day. Staff at the breakfast and the maids we met were great, however, the front desk staff were less than helpful. Samir, who seemed more interested in personal phone calls than helping guests surprised us with an 8 Euro room tax at checkout. This cost was not listed anywhere on the website and according to Samir needed to be paid in cash. When we questioned him he said there was no manager available to discuss this with. While not a large sum, we couldn't help but feel we were being taken advantage of because we were in a hurry to catch a train and he was insistent upon payment. I would love to have a response from Hotel Columbia Management about this charge as of course it did not show up on any receipt we were provided. We would not stay in this hotel nor recommend it to any fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shame about the internet”
Reviews.Author: helene_pridmore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location with friendly staff and good amenities. Some rooms are excellent but some are very small for the price. The breakfast is adequate but not the best I have had and the roof terrace is very pleasant. There is quite a nice lounge area upstairs in the bar, although it is very small. The downside for me was the expensive use of the internet. They are charging enough for the rooms to include free internet as most large hotels do these days. It costs them nothing extra and is a service that is more and more essential, especially for the business traveller. There was an internet cafe about 100 yards from the hotel but the point is that they are putting off customers by their pettiness in making a few extra euros for internet use. When you are paying this price anyway, if they charged a few extra euros nobody would really notice and the benefits of having 24 hour wifi just give a better impression.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: franksbeans2001
Reviews.Content: The wife and I just needed a place to sleep in our one day/night in Rome. The room was really small, but the location is really great. It's an easy walk to the Termini train station even with luggage... easy being a relative term, I would imagine. The room was clean, the bed was hard as a rock, and the shower pressure was extreme. Not sure what else can be said for the place (we left too early in the morning to experience the breakfast, although the rooftop terrace did appear to be a lovely place for it).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff/service, great location near train and metro, wireless, modern, and nice roof top common area.”
Reviews.Author: joel_in_dallas
Reviews.Content: The inside was nice and clean with tasteful decorations. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The rooms are not big but were fine for my spouse and I. The location near the Termini (main train station) was important to us. It was a reasonable walk with our backpacks. The breakfast was excellent. In the evening the roof top common bar/eating area was nice for some wine and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra1087395
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good situated, near the station where also all the busses are. The room was very nice and clean and the staff was helpfull and kind. Breakfast was exellent. Because of the weather we didn't got the chance to have breakfast at the roof terrace, but we took a look and it was beautiful. we can recommand this hotel to everybody who wants to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient choice for a base”
Reviews.Author: Highlander770
Reviews.Content: The Columbia is near the Central Train station making in great to get to and from the airport, and to catch buses or trains for sightseeing and day trips. The place is pretty with a great roof top terrace, where breakfast is served. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “breakfast on the rooftop”
Reviews.Author: bam4ith
Reviews.Content: We loved having a wonderful breakfast on the rooftop terrace every morning! The staff are very friendly and helpful. Great Location as mentioned in the other reviews. Our room was clean, but small. If wireless is important I would try to book a room on the higher floors. We could not get it in our room (310). Buying the 'Roma Pass' saved us some money on the Metro and Museums. Also, they were working on the Metro when we were there and shut it down at 11pm. Worth asking about if you like to be out late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Old fashined, Relaxing, Perfect location - felt like our home in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_B_nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week - for business & leisure purposes. The hotel is located near Termini Station which makes it accessible to all the attractions and must-go places in Rome. This is one of the best hotel we have stayed in. Right from checking in to the last day, we received the BEST SERVICE any hotel could ever gave. I would say the best part of staying here was the service given: - the staffs were polite and friendly (I even get a daily Italian language lessons from the cleaners & servers) - anything we requested via room service will only take a few minutes to be delivered - the hotel provides free organic pillows made from wheat and other natural stuffs which we can requests as many as we want. they even have as explanation card inside the room on the specific pillow stuffings and its purposes. they were great & gave us relaxing nights after a whole day walking. - one elderly man in the kitchen even took the time to explain to me the ingredients of certain food for breakfast. -every morning the reception staffs recommended us a local places to go and the best places to have pizzas! The map provided by the hotel is useful as we found our way around Rome just by referring to the map. The hotel eventhough a bit rustic and old fashioned (which I love!) is very clean and in good condition. They use old style furniture made from woods inside the rooms and in the lounge. Surrounding the terrace for breakfast are many kinds of flowers and fruit plants. You will enjoy the peaceful atmosphere while having your breakfast! Sometimes you'll get to feed small birds that comes & go. We would definitely stay in this hotel again if we go back to Rome. Tips: don't forget to ask about the nearby morning market as they have a wonderful selections of branded clothings for cheap price!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in small family hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandyIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: Located near the train and bus stations yet convenient for walking to main attractions, this friendly hotel had a cosy feel. Good service, good choice for continental breakfast, room clean and comfy. Lovely sunny roof terrace suitable for afternoon or evening drink or breakfast. Restaurants nearby. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Molto buono!”
Reviews.Author: Galloping_Gael
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Columbia is almost perfectly situated and outfitted for those who wish to do a lot of sightseeing in Rome. The location - two blocks from Termini station and walking distance to a number of classic Roman sites - is convenient. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The second-floor suite with loft bedroom and small terrace is particularly nice. The fifth-floor breakfast space, lounge and outside terrace is very calming and breakfast is great. The staff is friendly and attentive. Drawbacks: Wi-fi doesn't reach into all the rooms. There seems to be some upgrades going on in the hotel and construction in the neighborhood, so things can get a little noise, particularly during the day. But that's Rome. In short, I would stay here again in an instant. Nice place.

Reviews.Title: “returned to the Columbia - still fabulous. Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: rmp1968uk
Reviews.Content: Can not bang on enough about how good this hotel is. We stayed for a week and slept so well every night! Ideally located - either to walk or take the metro, and only 5 minutes from the main station. The breakfast was great, as before - but it really is the people that make this place - so cheerful, polite and kind. If you want somewhere reasonably central to the city of Rome, spotlessly clean and wonderfully comfortable - this is the place, absolutely look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Nice oasis in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: tpage_97
Reviews.Content: This little hotel does a great job of creating an oasis in the center of Rome. Walkable from Termini station - even with suitcases in tow, the hotel is spotless and quiet. Main attractions range from a 15 - 30 minute walk, or a really short cab ride. The breakfast is fantastic, and the staff are superbly helpful. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In center of Rome, but very quiet in room”
Reviews.Author: jacqieo
Reviews.Content: Very comfertabel and clean rooms and friendly staff. We loved the decoration in the room and restaurant, although its not our style. Plenty of space for our stuff in our room. No noice from traffic in the room (on the backside of the hotel) so we can sleap very well. And posiballity to close a chelter for the window. 10 minute walk to trainstation and 5 min to metrostation. Also a few restaurants and nice shops next to the hotel and around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackoIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights for a sightseeing trip to Rome. The location was good as it was near several Metro stops and also the main train station which had trains running to and from the airport. Due to delay in our flight connections we arrived before our luggage. However the Egyptian gentleman on reception was extremely helpful in dealing with the airport staff to retrieve our bags which arrived after 2 days. We were very grateful to him. The breakfast was served on a balcony overlooking the street. we paid 180 euros per night which we thought was expensive as the hotel room itself was small and not worth this rate. There were many restaurants nearby which we sampled most nights.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: _MichaelGorman
Reviews.Content: After more than 10 stays over the last 4+ years, this review is long overdue... I can only hope that my review might still reach anyone traveling to Rome, & that they might have the pleasure of experiencing a hotel that has quite honestly become my home away from home, & a staff that has become a part of my family no matter where I am! The Hotel Columbia is conveniently located just a few minutes walk from Termini Station on an equally safe & quiet side street that is just steps from the Red line metro, multiple bus stops, and from Piazza Republica & It's majestic fountain. This location offers amazing convenience to get directly to the city center, while being just far enough out to allow for a comfortable evening walk & peaceful nights rest. If these criteria weren't enough already, the staff themselves are like nothing I have seen before in hundreds of hotels across more than 20 countries.Once inside the hotel, it is easy to notice that cleanliness, style, comfort, and more importantly pride in what they do is at the utmost level of importance for every staff member from the very top down. Simply put, they actually enjoy having you as a guest, and are willing to do anything within their means to make your Hotel Columbia Experience and enjoyable & memorable one. From the warm greetings of Victoria & Anche, to Pietro's incredible smile & cappuccini, and if you are lucky - an afternoon drink on the terrace with Patrizia, every moment at the Columbia is memorable to say the very least! Although the straight forward details of the hotel are enough to convince nearly anyone, to understand my experiences it is important to go back to the beginning, and follow what has led me feel confident that as long as the Hotel Columbia is in Rome, I will always have a home away from home! I must admit that my first stay was due to a very fortunate disaster, where I found myself very overwhelmed & very without a place to stay. I stumbled into the small but beautiful lobby of the Columbia, a site that I now know so well, for the very first time with luggage on both arms and an equally combined look of fear, frustration, and failure to enjoy my time in Rome. I fully expected to be laughed right back out the door as I asked if there was any chance for a room for my final remaining night, not to mention at a ridiculous rate that matched my almost completely depleted funds. Whether it was just my lucky day, or the wonderful woman ( whom I now know as Victoria) just felt bad for me, I will never know. All I do know is that upon hanging up with the owner, she looked at me, smiled widely, and said "We just happen to have a special right now for that exact rate!". Since that very first stay I have never turned back, and do not intend to. In the time that has gone by, I have taken groups as large as 24 to Rome, groups as small as 3, and even my parents & family; every time having stayed at the Hotel Columbia. I have yet to find anyone who did not thoroughly enjoy their stay. The incredible & unique stories that have resulted are far to many to share here, but the one thing I can assure everyone reading, is that when it comes to hotels in the "Eternal City", the Hotel Columbia will FOREVER be the only choice for my employees, clients, friends, and of course myself & my family. Do yourself and your fellow travelers an enormous favor, and choose the Hotel Columbia for your next visit to Rome. I can guarantee that if you do, it will most certainly not be your last!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and homely.”
Reviews.Author: Dianawo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated about 7 mins walk from Termini (bus and train station). There are a number of good restaurants within walking distance (Bar L'europee is very good and well priced). The rooms are small but comfortable and clean and there was no bath but a lovely shower in the bathroom. There is a nice roof garden and the staff in the breakfast area were friendly and professional. The breakfast provided a good choice with plenty of pastries, meat, cheese and walnut bread to die for. No evenign meal provided. Reception staff were knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: KvB3822
Reviews.Content: We felt quite at home at this hotel. The rooms were beautifully decorated with glas chandeliers and provided exactly wat we needed after a long day admiring all the historical sites that Rome is filled with. They were well isolated from the hustle and bustle that is Rome. No noices! The staff are quietly friendly and very capable. The building is well maintained, the rooms and corridors are clean, they have a wonderful breakfast buffet with very friendly service. (Romans apparantly have a sweet tooth!) We apreciated very much the fact that after the first day the receptionist knew our room number and the waitress at the breakfast buffet knew our preference for tea in the morning. Small things that make a big difference. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, WOULD COME BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: mlugones
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on finding a reasonably priced, conveniently located hotel that had very positive reviews. My friend and I decided on Hotel Columbia. Prior to booking the hotel, the staff promptly answered all my questions both via email and when I called. They also took note of my requests and fulfilled them. The location was great: a couple of blocks from Termini (the major train station in Rome), and across the street from a cafe/bar for evening snacks and cravings. The room rate included breakfast, which was a plus. The breakfast is simple: yogurt, cereals, juices, milk, bread, pastries, and cappuccino, which did the trick. Also, breakfast is not a major meal in Italy, so this was extensive by most standards. The entire staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was clean, and with the scare of bed bugs on the rise around the world, I was very careful in choosing a hotel. There were no reviews of bed bug spottings at Hotel Columbia, and I personally checked out the beds and sheets and found no obvious signs of bed bugs (I'm not an expert by any means, but I've looked into what signs to watch for, and yes, I am a paranoid New Yorker!). I found the neighborhood around the hotel to be safe (contrary to previous reviews) and actually a breath of fresh air from the tourist-dense parts of Rome. If you take some time to walk around the hotel, there are lots of clothing stores, restaurants, and bars. I actually preferred to eat near the hotel because of the restaurant selection. Not to mention that you aren't far from the major sights and monuments anyway...we found ourselves walking all over and ended up walking home a lot of the time. And one day we we walking not too far from our hotel and turned the corner and saw the Colosseum just a few blocks away...we were surprised how "walkable" Rome really was! Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at Hotel Columbia, and I would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and practical location”
Reviews.Author: Lino2939
Reviews.Content: Less than 5 mins walk from the Termini train station, and walking distance away from the Colosseum. Columbia is a very charming hotel - rooms are small but clean and sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice, would definitely stay there again if I went to Rome and would highly recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: Mars97
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, nicely decorated hotel with all the amenities you would expect from a nice hotel and it is very conveniently located. It is walking distance to the Termini Station, which makes it convenient to catch a bus and the metro. It is also within walking distance to a lot of the major sight seeing sites. We especially enjoyed the breakfast served every morning in the dining room on the top floor or the open terrace off the dining room. It was a wonderful way to start off each day before sight seeing. We also found the staff very friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations as to where to eat, etc. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- a little outside of the main tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: kareneg061
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms. We got a suite which had two rooms- fits four but fits 2 more comfortably. We had to walk a long way to hit the good restaurants and famous sites, but at least we could walk because those cab drivers are crrrrazy!

Reviews.Title: “An elegant, comfortable, convenient hotel with friendly, kind, and gracious staff.”
Reviews.Author: JoelSchuman
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Columbia for years. We like the location - a block from Termini, easy walk from the airport train. Although the Termini neighborhood is a bit tamer than it used to be, looking at the street life from our window is still a kick - like a balcony seat at a happening - political marches, cafés, and a constant parade of interesting people. Yet when the cafés close it's as quiet as can be. The hotel itself is beautiful: tasteful, restrained, low-key, well-kept and comfy. Be sure to walk every floor to see the art on the walls - like staying in a museum - no - like being a guest in the home of an impassioned art collector. The rooms are not huge, but they very, very nicely done. The linens, in particular, are notable. Breakfast is super, and if weather permits do take it on the rooftop terrace, which is lovely. The terrace is also a great place for a bottle of wine in the afternoon or evening. Of course the make-or-break for a hotel is its staff, and Hotel Columbia has a great team. It's much the same staff as when we first visited 15 years ago, which says a lot about the management. Much as we like trying new places, when we visit Rome we don't even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janzie19
Reviews.Content: Just a 5 minute walk from Termini Station. Looked a bit rough from the outside due to closed businesses each side. Many good cafes and restaurants locally, so many to choose from. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist and given maps and brochures. The room was on the small side for the price but we were told we could change to a bigger room next day. ( we didn't bother as everything was so nice) We received a lovely bottle of sparkling wine for our wedding anniversary with a niced note... Room cleaned and beds changed daily, immaculate.... Breakfast very good, lots of choice great coffee, friendly waitress. So close to everything, strolling distance to most attractions and Metro just on next corner. Pity about the cost as it has everything you could wish for on a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WD_LV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off the Termini subway stop, which is ideal because every line goes to Termini, and to transfer, you have to go to Termini so it was nice not to transfer and exit instead to go to our hotel. We opted for the standard room, which was very pricey and therefore not what we expected. It was a TINY room with high ceilings (not ideal for two people). Because we were out all day, and only in our room to sleep, this didnt bother us too much, but it certainly taught us a lesson about booking a room in Rome. Otherwise, the staff was nice and the breakfast was great. If I stayed here again I would get the larger superior room, which is better for two people (however, I would probably try to stay somewhere else in the same area first). Best pizza place in Rome - Dar Poeta in Trasvestere (try to make a reservation if you can otherwise the wait is long).

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a budget trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: FDawson
Reviews.Content: Two doors away from the Opera theatre, and a five minute walk to buses, trains and metro at Termini, the location is convenient if ever so slightly seedy. Once inside the lobby, everything becomes clean and calm and welcoming. Do make sure you have a good map with a street index, though - Rome is a maze of streets and Piazzas, ideal for walking, but exhausting, especially if you keep retracing your steps! The hotel Columbia is just right if you want somewhere to come back to where you can feel comfortable with a beer or a bottle of Prosecco at a good price before you set out for the evening. The roof terrace is an oasis, or the sofas in the lounge area are a good place to relax and chat to other guests. Staff are helpful and friendly. I chose this hotel after reading reviews which mentioned Fairtrade produce at breakfast - I wasn't aware of any such. Breakfast was slightly disappointing - a wide range of continental items, but not enough fresh fruit or wholemeal bread for my liking. I don't really want cake and tinned fruit on the breakfast bar. That aside, I felt it was a very good hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alison_skellern
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a lovely holiday in Rome. I booked the Columbia on the basis of comments made on this site and I was not disappointed: It's in a good location for exploring the city; very clean and comfortable; excellent service and customer care from the staff. Breakfact was very generous and the room had everyting we needed, including an electronic safe which we didn't have to pay extra for, unlike other hotels I have stayed in. I would love to return to Rome some day, and if I do I will be booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!!”
Reviews.Author: Rome2010Rome
Reviews.Content: We were due to stay at the Hotel Columbia in April but had to cancel due to the ash cloud problems. I had already paid for the rooms in full, however, the owner kindly agreed to allow us to rebook our reservation in September without charge. The location is just 100 metres or so from the Termini for buses, trams and the underground. The hotel is clean, the staff are great and so friendly and the roof terrace is a great place to sit in the sunshine, have breakfast and plan which of the wonderful sights you are going to visit that day. I can't recommend this hotel enough, I would go there again without a moments hesitation. Phil Haywards Heath, West Sussex

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE HAVEN”
Reviews.Author: Michaela-Cat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Columbia for 4 nights and got back yesterday. I can only follow the other comments on here, this Hotel is supurb. The breakfast is gorgouse and there is a big choice. Rooms are very very clean. The Receptionists Victoria and Samir really went out of their way to help with any questions I had. Tip: Get the Hotel to order your taxi in advance to going and also at the end of your trip. The cost was 40 Euros. The Metro is good but if you are going from Termini Station, it is one hell of a schlepp! I cannot recommend The Hotel Columbia strong enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: IslandTraveller
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Columbia. The rooms are small , but we were not there to spend time in the room. The breakfast on the roofdeck is great and the satff are easy to deal with. We were concerned about the area, but found that we were withing 45 minutes of walking to everywhere- including the vatican. The train station is a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fab,Fab,Fab.”
Reviews.Author: johnLmerseyside
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a 5 night break at the Hotel Columbia, booked this hotel from other Tripadvisor comments and could not agree more with all the other guests excellant reviews, staff were very friendly and helpfull at all times, would certinaly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “A great place to return to after a busy day in Rome”
Reviews.Author: starfish1
Reviews.Content: If you want to be convenient to the train station, the Hotel Columbia is a great choice. It's in a decent area with a good choice of restaurants and cafes. The hotel is not much to look at from the outside and the lobby is a bit tired but our room was spotless, quiet and comfortable, although I must admit the bed was a bit on the hard side. The staff are extremely friendly, accommodating and very helpful. The lounge and breakfast room are on the top floor and are charming. Breakfast was plentiful, fresh and delicious. The rooftop patio is a beautiful place to start or end the day. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Columbia and would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant comfortable hotel in convenient location in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: ch08m
Reviews.Content: The Columbia is a very friendly hotel with excellent customer service.Staff go out of their way to be helpful and courteous, even sending a complimentary bottle of wine to our room for a special occasion. Our room was quiet,at the back of the building, with immaculate bedlinen and towels.A good selection of toiletries are provided in the bathroom.We particularly enjoyed breakfast on the lovely roof terrace each morning,there was always a good selection of food to choose from that set us up for the day. I would recommend the Columbia to anyone seeking a small, unique family hotel that will make your vist to Rome truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue1412
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful and for breakfast you could eat as much as you liked on the wonderful rooftop terrace. The hotel was located within walking distance of the all the main sights of interest, such as the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (15/20 minutes). My daughter and I walked everywhere (including to the Vatican City - 45 minutes), although would not recommend August for a visit, as the temperatures reached 35 degrees. Take hats/parasols/fans and light covering for shoulders when visiting the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “calm comfortable oasis”
Reviews.Author: lou09
Reviews.Content: So very pleased with the Columbia. After a hot July day in the city, wonderful to walk into the serenity of this hotel. Loved the white comfortable bedding and quality furniture. We had 2 rooms, one of which was a little too small for 2 people and 2 large cases. I asked if we could change rooms and this was no problem at all. The staff were helpful and the terrace breakfast was superb. Thank you Columbia and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pippenandchops
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel columbia in Rome for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon. We very impressed with the standard and cleanliness of the room. Our room was of a very high standard and had a 'Boutiqueness' feel to it. Its nice to stay in a hotel which is not part a corporate chain, The staff were very helpful prior to our arrival helping us with directions and reccommending restaurants to us. When we arrived back to our room on the first night we were welcomed back to a chilled bottle of bubbly. It was an extremely generous gesture that made our stay even more memorable. The hotel has a very quaint and lovely roof terrace where you can enjoy breakfast which there was a great selection with lovely cappacinos. We enjoyed a late night bottle of wine on the terrace one evening which was very reasonable priced compared to other places we visited in Rome and just a lovely setting. We would defiantely stay or reccommend this hotel for others visiting Rome. The location is ideal as we were able to walk everywhere to all the sites and its conviently close to the train station and next to the opera house. The hotel also arrange a taxi to and from the airport at 40 euros which we felt was reasonable as the train for 2 people cost 28 euros. Thank you Hotel Columbia for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis pf calm”
Reviews.Author: ManWithSillyHat
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights this summer (2010). The hotel is close to the main rome terminus, so good for short stays or trips with heavy back-packs. the street-front is particularly unassuming, but inside is modern, clean and efficient. Note also that there is a supermarket (underground) just a block or so away. Double rooms are good size and well appointed. There is some street noise - as to be expected - with the inevitable car horn etc. The walls are a little on the thin side though. Bathroom good size with good shower. The Hotel's real gem is the top floor terrace, which serves as breakfast bar, bar and sun trap. it makes a nice oasis of calm from plodding around the sites all day. bar prices reasonable too. Definitely recommend for a short stay, only quibble would be to check your bill for the odd rogue phone call.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff, best location, best breakfast balcony, best rates”
Reviews.Author: MiMiPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Don't look for anyplace else in Rome. Hotel Columbia is the ideal location for both walking and riding the metro and trains. We had 7 people in our group, ages 12 to 65 and wanted to see as much of Rome and surrounding sites as possible. Being close enough to Termini and yet staying in a safe location was important. Hotel Columbia has friendly, courteous and informative staff, a very good breakfast and a beautiful balcony for breakfast and relaxation. Every room was spotlessly clean with comfortable beds. This was my second stay and if I am fortunate to come back to Rome, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: mblbjn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The staff was helpful and friendly. The roof top patio was a wonderful place to start and end our day in Rome. The staff in charge of the the roof top patio were exceptional! The breakfast offerings exceeded our expectations greatly. I would highly recommend the Hotel Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff, don't be put off by the outside, great inside”
Reviews.Author: eve046
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed here for our 1st visit to ~Rome. Location is good, easy access to all sites, plenty of restaurants nearby. Breakfast served on hotel rooftop was really good - it was also open in the evening for drinks-great atmsphere when you have had a hard day's sightseeing. All the staff could not have been more helpful! ~When we arrived we didnt like the look of the outside of the hotel, but dont be put off. Small friendly hotel - loved Rome and cant wait to go back - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: viajeroUKLondon
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the exterior - lovely hotel in a nice spot of Rome. I stayed in the luxury room, which comes with a nice sized patio and had a big basket of complimentary fruit in the room. Very friendly staff and reasonably priced mini bar. Good TV and could plug in ipod to play music.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: KitWidnes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two friends stayed at the Columbia for 4 nights in May 2010. The hotel exceeded our expectations, even though we had read the reviews before going. The area is very safe and there are lots of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. The hotel is located within 5 to 10 minute walk to the train station and ideally situated for all site seeing (make sure you take some good walking shoes). The Hotel itself was very clean and the staff were excellent. The breakfast served on the lovely roof terrace was a bonus and the food was excellent & plentiful. On arriving home our friends realised that they had left credit cards hidden in the bedroom (there is a free safe in the room ) and promptly rang the hotel. They were located and posted on to them. We really can't praise them enough. When we return we will definitely stay here again. Do use the taxi service, it's faster than the train and cheaper @ 40 euros v 60 euros for the train. The hotel arranged the taxi for us going home, we paid the hotel and they gave us a receipt to hand over to the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Hotel Columbia, Rome”
Reviews.Author: tomthumb187069
Reviews.Content: This hotel greatly exceeded expectations for a 3 star hotel. The staff were wonderful. There were beautiful flower arrangements everywhere. The breakfast buffet was huge. Beautiful food that set you up for the day and served on a lovely roof terrace. The rooms were comforatble and the bed linen was changed almost everyday. All the staff, receptionists, cleaners waitresses were so kind and helpful. We would definitely stay there again. Good location too, so near the international railway station and airport buses.

Reviews.Title: “Cute patio”
Reviews.Author: DSAustin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbia was great. Rooms were on the small side but decent for Europe. Great breakfast and wonderful patio for breakfast and an afternoon coffee. Staff was helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guernsey84
Reviews.Content: When the taxi pulled up out side the hotel we were a little apprehensive but once inside we were pleasantly suprised. We had a lovely quiet room at the back of the hotel. The room and bathroom were both very clean and fresh. We spent each of our three nights on the roof top tearrace sipping wine and cappucino's. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Within 15 minutes walking distance of the main sights, the hotel provided a map and explained how to get to places of interest. Plenty of restaurants/bistros near to the hotel. The Columbia was lovely to come back to each evening I would highly recommend this hotel. For an extra plus the opera theatre is at the end of the road, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for Rome”
Reviews.Author: GrecianHighworthUK
Reviews.Content: On arrival this hotel looks nothing form the outsdie but once inside it is clean and welcoming. Room was clean and comfortable. Excellent breakfast on roof garden. Only 6 minutes on foot from the Termini Station. Really convenient for all major sites in Rome. We walked everywhere. Some good restaurants nearby. So it is ideal if you are doing the sites fo Rome.

Reviews.Title: “what a find!”
Reviews.Author: rmp1968uk
Reviews.Content: walked up the street and saw the outside of the Columbia, and out hearts sank. However, once inside everything was different! Beautiful rooms - with pillow menu! Fabulous bathrooms. Breakfast on the roof terrace, such helpful staff - ask them where to eat! We can not recommend this hotel highly enough - they even gave us a bottle of Champagne for my partner's birthday - completely unexpected. Close to the centre of the city - the trains are easily walkable, but quiet. If you want a 3* haven, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy - good location - friendly, helpful staff - clean - rooftop garden”
Reviews.Author: fiskars
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on our two-night stay by pre-paying for our room, and were very happy with the hotel and its staff. The rooms are small by some standards, but not small in comparison to most European hotels. Our room was very clean, and had a lot of nice touches, such as monogramed linens and crocheted bedside table covers. Victoria at the front desk was very helpful, as was Aurora at the breakfast bar each morning -- beautiful rooftop garden lounge. From the fresh flower arrangements to the very good location (in terms of walkability to the various tourist attractions and train station), we couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel was not necessarily quiet, but I think one must spend a LOT to find that in the center of Roma! When we arrived in Rome by train, it was a fairly easy, short walk from the Termini train station to the hotel. When we left for the airport, we decided to take a cab, which the hotel arranged, and we were glad we'd chosen that option as it was quick and efficient and relieved some of the stress of making sure we made our flight home. We would definitely recommend the Hotel Columbia to friends, and will return there ourselves. We thought it a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbia - 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: SprucedUp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbia three nights prior to our cruise in late April and one night following. In a nutshell, we were very very satisfied with the cleanliness, rooms, service, and professionalism of this hotel. We reviewed various hotels online and chose this hotel based upon a number of recommendations i.e Frommer's, TripAdvisor, etc. We booked online using their own hotel site and paid in advance for a preferrred rate. This worked well. There were no surprises and the price was very good for the services provided. Upon arriving, all was in order. The staff were very polite, competent, and helpful for restaurant recommendations, taxis, travel advice, etc. The rooms were clean and comfortable, as were the hallways and terrace area. Loved the sheets. Breakfast each morning on the 5th floor was generous and fresh. While some might shy away from the Termini area, this worked very well for us. In two blocks we had access to buses and metro, which we used travelling to the Vatican, etc. We did not find the area particularly dirty or threatening as some literature might suggest. We used taxis on occasion but do recommend letting the hotel call the taxi. Their taxis were legit. My wife had a birthday during our stay. The manager of the hotel was particularly helpful in recommending a very good restaurant and ensuring that we enjoyed a complementary bottle of prosecco prior to an evening out. All of this was accomplished online. The customer service extended to us was generous and straightforward. Much appreciated. This was as well reflected by the staff during our stay. We would stay at the Columbia again without hesitation. As said, no surprises - or rather it was a pleasant surprise - and an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: simmixit
Reviews.Content: We went for our anniversary and couldn't have been looked after better. As independant travellers you always take a risk in deciding your hotel but the Hotel Columbia was great. Thanks for making our trip so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Melos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a three night break at Hotel Columbia as part of a package. Patrizia and her team made us very welcome and the hotel lived up to our expectations based on other reviews by Tripadvisor members; our room was very comfortable and the breakfasts set us up for the day! The hotel is an easy walk from the Termini station (take the train from the airport, the bus is cheaper but takes much longer) and a 15 minutes walk from the main attractions (the Colosseum and Forum; the Trevi Fountain; the Pantheon to name the ones we most wanted to see). Again the hotel staff will help with directions and suggestions for places to eat; we tried Pasta Love (Via Palermo) and had a really nice meal. There is also a good restaurant just outside the hotel if it is tipping down! If you want to see the Vatican Museums, booking in advance on line is essential: the queue when we arrived at 11:30 was half-way round the Vatican (12 Euros each plus 4 Euro booking fee). The entrance is at the furthest point from St Peter's : take the Metro Line A (Direction Battistini, get off at Cipro - Vatican Museums). Go straight to the head of the queue and show your voucher to gain immediate access to the ticket office. To see the Sistine Chapel, you join a long, slow crocodile which wends its way round a stunning but very long series of rooms. After you have fallen out of the Chapel in a bemused state, head for the Pinacoteca - a quiet contrast to the Sistine Chapel crush, with some fine religious paintings to look at. To see St Peter's Basilica you have to exit the Museums and walk back round to the Piazza, and then queue for ages to get through an airport style security check.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and helpful”
Reviews.Author: crimsonkatie
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was clean and the staff cannot be faulted. The hotel was very basic. No kettle etc in the room, the bed was very hard and the room was very small. Not at all suitable for a romantic weekend which was what we visited for. Rome is an amazing place but incredibly expensive £6 for a bottle of beer! Be prepared before you go and take adequete money with you. Sadly the area in which the hotel is in is right next to the station, when we got off the train we were faced with rows and rows of tramps asleep on the pavement, Grafitti all over the shutters and walls like we had never seen before. It was not at all what we expected. Local shopkeepers were telling us to put our money safely away before walking out onto the street. Aside from the helpful staff at the hotel, We left our short stay feeling like we had been truly ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “F A B U L O U S - what a gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cazdal
Reviews.Content: Fabulous time with a group of friends in this beautifully presented, spotlessley clean and very friendly Hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff helped us plan our day and recommended restaurants for evening meals. Breakfast choice was tremendous - breads, cheeses, hams, yougurts, fruit, cereals - so much choice and endless coffee or tea or fruit juice, and served on the top floor with a roof terrace. Comfortable, well presented bedroom with all amenities including lots of towels, hairdryer, shower gels and a mini bar! We had a lovely lovely time and Rome is a must on everyones travel itinerary. We will definitely be back and would definitely stay at the Columbia again. Perfectly situated for all the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!! Excellent breakfast. Prime Location. Great Service. Very Clean.”
Reviews.Author: HotelConsultant777
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this property. The owners are from Switzerland. This is a small hotel with a fabulous rooftop patio/breakfast room/lounge. Breakfast is served on Villeroy & Boch china. The rooms are beautifully furnished with Venitian chandaliers and beautiful brass trimming. Very clean. The owners have chosen a neat logo which embroidered on the pillows, towels, and even the carpet has the same design. The hotel feels like a limited service, higher end three star boutique hotel. I would highly recommend it! You can purchase lattes, cappuccino, etc. all day long in the lounge. The service is execellent! Warm and friend housekeeping and a very efficient and friendly Manager Lady. Small rooms, but every room comes with a pillow menu, so you can choose from several different pillow types.

Reviews.Title: “All round good hotel, good location for sight seeing.”
Reviews.Author: WestSussexTrevor
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely long weekend at Hotel Columbia. The staff were friendly and the room clean and comfortable. Lovely dining room serving a generous continental breakfast on the top floor, Whilst not important to us during our stay it would have been nice to have a wider selection of TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Columbia surpassed all our expectations: a sparkling gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOtravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: We booked after reading favourable reviews and were not disappointed! The Columbia was even better than we had hoped it would be. Our room was large, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Service was unfailingly cheerful and professional -- from reception, restaurant and housekeeping staff alike. Everyone went out of their way to be friendly and helpful, and we can't thank them enough for their kindness. We walked all over Rome from this excellent location, and were grateful for the helpful suggestions offered when we told reception where we were heading each day. We stayed at Columbia for 9 nights and were sorry when our stay was over.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stringerbailey
Reviews.Content: Very peacefull Hotel, great breakfast, rooms clean. In a great location, for the Termini, and close to shops. loads of restaurants within walking distance. It was my mothers 70th birthday whilst we were there, and the hotel staff gave her a lovely surprise of a bottle of wine and a card. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “For a lovely little hotel near to everything in Rome, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Ontario_Canada
Reviews.Content: The Columbia is nothing to look at from the outside but it's only a block from the opera, three blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore, 20 minutes or so from the Coliseum, 15 minutes from the Spanish Steps and 5 minutes from the station. The service is excellent - staff can't do enough to please you. Rooms are typical European - a little on the small side for North Americans but very nicely furnished and very comfortable. Good TV for when you need to crash. Reasonably priced internet by comparison to other Italian hotels we had visited. Breakfast - included - is very, very nice and relaxed. We had to check out at 5 a.m. and a box breakfast was waiting for us at the desk. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Best recommendation? Next time we go to Rome we're staying at the Columbia again.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: shelbyT
Reviews.Content: when , you first see the hotel from the outside you will not be impressed, but once you get inside you will be very comfortable in the charming rooms. Breakfast is lovely and ample and can be taken outside on the terrace if the weather is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Inside theft twice have ruined the Columbia for me”
Reviews.Author: zjohnsonj
Reviews.Content: I selected the Columbia for two visits to Rome (2007 and 2009) based on personal experience and the reviews here on Trip Advisor. For the 2009 visit, we stayed for 3 days when we first arrived and had a great experience (outside of being robbed, if that makes any sense), and stayed for one night on our way back to the states and had a bad experience. When we stayed at the Columbia on our way back we were treated to a rude front deskman and a smoking room with a non-functioning A/C unit. We arrived late (7 PM) but had confirmed our late arrival. Nevertheless, when we pointed this out and asked for a non-smoking room, we were told there were none available that "that's what happens when you arrive late." Another front deskman the next morning had no idea of where in the train station to buy the tickets for the airport train. But my main complaint is this: In my 2007 stay, I arrived back home to find that my guidebook to Rome and a small gift I'd purchased while there was not in my luggage (I'd packed both away before my last night in Rome). I emailed the hotel and asked if they had found them, and they said they had not. I chalked it up to carelessness and them possibly getting underneath the bed or tangled in the bedding (and taken by the staff, of course), but my instinct told me I HAD packed them in my suitcase. I should have listened to my instincts. For my 2009 stay, I packed one dress shirt along with about five other casual shirts, still on their hangers. I placed them in the closet on arrival Friday and when I went to get the dress shirt for dinner Sunday night t was not there. Again, my first instinct was to think that I may have somehow changed my mind about taking the shirt (I had worn another similar colored dress shirt on the plane) but I was sure I had packed the shirt. It was then that I remembered of my previous visits’ experience of missing items. I didn't mention anything to the staff (why?) and when I got home I confirmed that the shirt was gone. So I've stayed at the Columbia twice and had items stolen from my room twice. You'd think I'd learn from the first visit. I can't imagine that I'm the only one that's had this happen to them. I did notice that if you stand at the front desk you can clearly see the keys of the rooms who's occupants are out; an easy job for someone w/ a hotel pass key. It’s too bad; the Columbia has almost been 100% wonderful, a great value, mostly friendly staff (the woman that works in the dining room on the weekends is a gem) and perfect location. But I’ll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: copspeech
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel my sister-in-law and I chose out of a recommendation in the New York Times. We were very happy with the choice. Minutes walk from the Colloseum and Roman Forum and a short ride to many other beautiful Roman sights, this was the perfect location. The room was comfortable and just what we needed after a long trip. The beds were great and the room was considered "large." The shower was perfect! We did not have a view but could lean out of the window and see the streets out front. There were several places to eat nearby and it was a couple of blocks from the train station. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There was a light breakfast included in the room price. The breakfast room was beautiful, with Venetian glass chandaliers and bright colors. The breakfast consisted of coffee, juices, assorted pastries, breads, cheeses and meats. It was just right to start the day! The only issue we had with the room was that we could not open the window and turn the heat on at the same time (but that was understandable). Otherwise, we had a wonderful, but short, two-night stay at the Hotel Columbia!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: RoundDaGlobe
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel very close to the train station. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Close to all the major attractions...Breakfast is so so..Customer service is good.. However, the rooms are not nice. Small rooms; Very dark color wall paper extremely tiny bathrooms..Internet is not free (3 euro for 1/2 hour)..Hence doesn't feel like getting the money's worth... If the room/ambience is not a major concern, then it's a good choice given the location..

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Gridstrod
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, very friendly and helpful staff, easy walking distance to all the major sites and many restaurants in surrounding area. Would recommend 24 hour bus pass "hop on/hop off" We did the journey 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: karenbeanpole
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Very convenient (5 mins from Termini, 3 mins from metro/bus to everywhere you want to go). Staff are very nice and eager to help, room and bathroom - clean and adequate and bed extremely comfortable. A la Carte Pillows so you can choose whatever you want. Breakfast is continental on top floor. Normal spread or bread, rolls, pastries, and cold meats and cheese, cereals, yoghurt. Enough to start the day. This hotel is very conveniently located for ALL the sights. Best place for dinner is Pasta Love. Ask at reception for directions. Only a 5 min walk away. Best pasta there. Concerning sightseeing, I would recommend taking a tour at the Colosseum (join any of the ones offered to you outside. We paid 20 euros each including entry) and the Vatican Museums, especially if you are clueless about art like me!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: KathrynGwent
Reviews.Content: My mum and I have just returned from Rome and stayed at this lovely, clean, friendly hotel for 4 nights. Central location, near Termini and major sights. Reception staff very helpful, provided maps and directions and spoke good English. Breakfast is taken on the rooftop terrace, which is a nice way to start the day. There are lots of restaurants around the hotel which are not too pricey. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: DoomedXIII
Reviews.Content: This is a great find... the location between Termini and Piazza della Repubblica was very convenient for metro and buses to just about anywhere in Rome. The staff was outstanding... they spoke great English and were very kind and helpful...they even sent a bottle of champagne to our room for our anniversary! The rooftop terrace was a beautiful place to have breakfast every morning... nice selection of meats, cheeses and pastries, though no hot items like eggs or bacon. Again, the breakfast staff was very charming and attentive. Awesome cappucino! The room itself was more spacious than we expected and very quiet... a great air-conditioned retreat from the chaos of Rome when we needed it. We were a little concerned about the reports of Termini being a "bad neighborhood", but we always felt safe, even at night. I've felt much more ill-at-ease in New York, L.A. or San Francisco... and I'm very glad we didn't pick a hotel in Trastevere, which seemed much more run-down and full of panhandlers. If you're used to urban environments, the Termini area isn't bad at all. If you don't need to stay overnight in the middle of the tourist hotspots like Spagna or Piazza Navona and you don't need a 5-star hotel, you would be hard-pressed to pick a better place than Hotel Columbia!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Octoberguy
