Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The room was great, the breakfast was fine, the location terrific, and the staff was marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, FANTASTIC, FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: karaoke512
Reviews.Content: Where do I start!! I booked this as a suprise for my Husbands 40th and was not disappointed. The hotel is in an excellent location. 20 mins in 1 direction to the Colloseum and 15 mins the other direction to the Spanish Steps. We walked our socks off (for over 10 hours) but didn't need any local transport. We only stayed for 2 days, so the fact that we didn't have to wait to anyone and anything was fab. No only is the hotel in a fab location, but it was extremely clean. Our room was great, burgandy walls, tall ceilings, HUGE chandalier and gold beddings, curtains and settee! (my fav colours!) Although I do think some other rooms are neutrel in colour. Our receptionist 'Andrea', went above the call of duty and catered to our every need and more. He even waited for us to return on my husbands birthday to send up a complimentary bottle of champagne!! I wanted to take my husband someone special with 'proper' italian food, where the italians eat. No worries, he told me of a restaurant 5 mins walk away which he goes to regularly himself, he rung and booked a table, gave us a map with instructions and off we went. The food was out of this world (restaurant name: Pasta Love!!), and although the owner couldn't speak much English, he knew far more than we did Italian, but we did get what we ordered (although I did feel very embarrassed as he apologies to us for not knowing much English, but I spoke to Andrea and asked him to explain how grateful we were) The hotel is on a b & b basis, and the breakfasts are fab, eaten on the roof terrace (although temperature still very hot at 8am), but there is plenty of seating inside. Lots of selection of food (not cooked), but you really don't need it when it's hot outside and you'll be doing lots of walking!! Absolutely fantastic time in Rome and got to see many of the sights in so little time. Always get a guided tour of the Coloseum, only costs additional €8 p.p (on top of the normal €12 entrance fee), but you get talk outside, skip the queue, tour inside (approx 1 hour) and even get a further 1 hour tour of the ruins next to the Coloseum. Absolute must and the tour quides are walking about outside the entrance. Also went to the Trip Elevator which is a 4d experience cinema (which is great when its hot) we went for the starting of the world & the Romans film. Approx 1 hour in total, was fab again and you had the glasses, headphones (in many languages) and it was all simulated with the seats moving with story (fab). Tevi fountain is a must, it took my breath away (which thrilled my husband!), and take your water bottles as the fountains, which are found in loads of places, is all drinking water, so fill your water bottles up with the cold water or have a wash!! Go to the Hotel Columbia and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PBculturevulture
Reviews.Content: Long weekend with friends doing the sights, bars & restaurants of Rome Great hotel in a good location, close to the Opera - easy walking to most sights, 5 mins from Terminii station for tour buses. Room small (out all day so didn't matter), but very comfortable, at back of hotel so nice and quiet. Well furnished and very clean. Staff all very friendly, good service, particularly on the roof terrace - nice place for a beer or two! Ideal location for exploring the city, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We would come back anytime”
Reviews.Author: Moppel1904
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the serviceat the entrance the first day, we arrived, it was a very pleasant stay at the columbus in rome. We had to change the room, because we booked non smoker and the room smells strong from the smoker, who used it before. We got then the room 326 and were very satisfied. We got the biggest room in the complete hotel and it was a complete "red" one. The breakfeast was good, the location on the roof deck (or roof terasse) ist very nice. There did we spent the late evening, when we came back from our visit-turns. The tips from the german speaking lady at the entrance were great, it was a big help for getting along in such a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and wonderful, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mroynan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of May, 2009. We were 4 women and we booked the only 4 person room (a rare find in Italy). It had 2 floors (a queen or king bed on first floor with desk area and a two singles on second floor also with a desk area). The hotel was clean and the staff was especially helpful. We stayed at the same hotel on our first leg of our trip and at the end of our trip and both times were great. The breakfast was good and the outdoor balcony breakfast room was very nice. The hotel is within a few minutes from Termini train station and easy to find. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SAGreat09
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Rome, I can only agree with the rave reviews of the Columbia. We stayed for 5 nights and loved our time there. Don't get put off by the outside, just walk through the front doors ( they will open for you) and be greeted by the front of house staff who, in our experience, are eternally cheerful, friendly and helpful. Our room on the 4th floor was really roomy with its Murano glass chandelier and wide screen TV ( cable). The airconditioning worked very well in the heat and storms of last week. The breakfast on the roof terrace is a delightful way to start each morning. We can't speak more highly of our time there. There are many cafes around, but take a hint and turn left after you leave the hotel, cross the road and walk to the end of Via del Viminale and eat at the Gran Caffe del Passeggero - and tell Saverio and Andrea that the Aussies sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly, super location for sights, gorgeous roof terrace wow”
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place, friendly staff, clean rooms and the roof terrace for breakfast and pre dinner drinks gave the hotel a warm and relaxed feel.I even had a bottle of bubbly sent up to the room for my birthday, what a kind thought.Our hotel room was very quiet for Rome as we were on the courtyard side. This I recommend asking for. We would certainly reommend this hotel to all of you reading this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and excellent accomodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: Islander055
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbia afforded us with the perfect place to experience and explore the eternal city of Rome. The rooms were beautifully decorated, clean, spacious and above all comfortable. The staff was helpful, friendly and corteous. The location allowed us to walk or use the metro to reach all the venues. The breakfast provided a wide selection and variety of food. The wine bar which is close by-The Fontana di Viminale, had good food and a very friendly and gracious service. Close to the hotel are areas which are rundown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good price, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: terikirk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Who wants to stay in a Best Western when you can stay in this wonderful place? This is an Italian hotel with a small lobby, but don't let that put you off. Hotel staff is very congenial & will help you with anything you need. The rooms are large compared to others, with mini-fridges and air conditioning. Many have beautiful Murano glass chandeliers. Breakfast is included and it is very good (hard boiled eggs, meats & cheeses, granola, yummy yogurt & really good coffee made just for you). Great water pressure in the shower. There is a lift (elevator). We also had them arrange for a car & driver as well. We had a larger group (7), so the car service was a great advantage. If you have a larger group, the car service prices are very reasonable & he takes you wherever you want to go & then picks you up whenever you say. Good shopping and great restaurants in the area, just ask the person at the front desk where to go. Not a seedy area - very safe to walk after dark (and we did, as many shops are open until 8 or 10pm.). This is the 2nd time I have stayed here and cannot wait until I can return. A flower truly blooms in Rome, and it is the Hotel Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Ravers!”
Reviews.Author: Jillstew
Reviews.Content: Just spent weekend at Columbia Hotel. Had emailed before we went as 7 of us & one special birthday. We were earlier than the check in time but two rooms ready for us & third was ready in 15 mins. All 3 three rooms close by each other & all very nice. The receptionist very helpful with restaurant recommendations & general tourist advice. First evening on roof terrace which is just lovely the hotel had organised complimentary bottle of champagne for my friend's birthday just a nice just before we went out for dinner. The hotel is in a very central location easy for getting around. Doesn't look much from outside but rooms spacious & adequate with lovely roof terrace for breakfast & drinks. I would certainly recommend this hotel & would definitely use again if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: zeberdeeKent
Reviews.Content: easy to find near termini, good restuarants nearby. walked all sites bar vatican city.receptionist marked map for routes to sites of interest.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eventeim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbia based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Literally steps from the train station it made for an easy transfer to FCO via the train. We normally do not stay in this area but were very happy we did. The staff was great and they helped us find some fabulous restaurants in the area (Formula 1 Pizza!!!). The first room we took was a little to small for two people. We moved to room 318 at the end of the hall which was larger and had a better layout. We wanted another room and thought that with the hotel less than half full they would have upgraded us as we were staying 3 nights. No luck…. The lift is glass enclosed so you can see out as you travel up and down. This is was very important for me as I am not a fan of elevators and most of them in Rome are tiny. For my business meeting the hotel was in a great location. To reach the Campo, Pantheon, etc it is a little bit of a hike. (We like to walk) however this is only a minor inconvenience. Cocktail hour on the roof deck is great. We ordered a bottle of wine and could not finish it so they put it aside for us to finish the next night. The breakfast looked great; however I am not one for public food so I cannot tell you how it tasted. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near the railway station”
Reviews.Author: Mendyss
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for two days (April 11 to April 12) with my wife and I booked this hotel according to the comments on tripadvisor. The hotel is 5 mins' walk from station Termini but if you are arriving via Leonardo Express from airport FCO, it takes 10 mins walk from the place you get off the train. The area where this hotel is located is full of hotels. Our hotel looks shabby from outside comparing with its neighbours as the building's outface is quite old. But as you walk into the lobby, everything is nice. The room is clean and big enough for a couple like us，and the bothroom was well-functioned. The room is quite during the night. The breakfast is nice and you can enjoy it at the outdoor platform on the top of the old building. The lady at the dining-hall was helpful and friendly, though she could hardly speak any English. One thing I don't like is that there is not free internaet in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Special 60th Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: jewelNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: As a special 60th birthday treat I booked this hotel for a few days sightseeing in Rome as my husband always wanted to go there. I chose Hotel Columbia because of the consistently good reviews on Tripadvisor and I was not disapointed. All the staff at this hotel are very friendly and helpful - nothing too much trouble. Breakfast is continental style with a good selection of pastries, cake, cereals, yogurt, boiled eggs,toast, juices and tea/coffee. When we arrived we were informed that the hotel had upgraded our room booking at no extra charge and we loved the room. It was very spacious with a definate 'Italian' feel to it - a very large and beautiful chandlier hung over the bed. On the evening of my husbands birthday a member of staff delivered a bottle of wine on ice with a handrwritten card from management wishing him a very good birthday. This was the 'icing on the cake' for him and really made the trip special. I have nothing to complain about regarding this hotel - we had a very pleasant stay there and we do travel quite often and stay in 4/5 star hotels. Hotel Colombia is well placed, about 10 minutes walk from the termini and within walking distance of most of the well known sights although we took the bus to the Vatican. Rome itself is a wonderful city with so many signts to see. We walked everywhere to all the most famous attractions also took a round trip on the RED open top tour bus which I would recommend - you can hop on/off or stay on for the full tour. I would recommend thick soled shoes for sightseeing as most of the ground is cobbled and this is hard on your feet ( my feet were so sore). Cafes/restaurants all good - we did not get one bad meal anywhere - all very good. All in all a very enjoyable and memorable trip for both sightseeing and hotel accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantistico!”
Reviews.Author: KSRSWales
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right near the main train station and underground tube stations. Also walking distance to the Colloseum. The staff are friendly and the hotel is clean. We were initially in a smaller room which was clean and adequate for a city break and the money we paid, but then we were upgraded for free to a superior room which was fantastic! Some things i'd wish someone had told me:- - There is a lovely authentic italian fish restaurant about 5-10mins from the hotel called da vincenzos. Full of italian people, excellent food and well priced! Jug of wine is 8euros! - Thats amore (restaurant) - don't be fooled by the look of it, its overpriced, staff are stroppy and food not great. -Get a metro pass for 3 days - 11 euros, can travel almost everywhere and it includes the buses too. - I missed it, but alot of people on the plane on the way back were saying how lovely the trevi fountain is at night. - Vatican museum- There are people selling tours but they work out around 50 euros each which are probably very good but inside the museum you can get an audio guide for 7 euros which is still good if your trying to save money for more wine! Lovely hotel and would definitly return!enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Four star wannabe”
Reviews.Author: highdesert99
Reviews.Content: Hotle Columbia is a plush, upscale hotel. Although nminaly rated at 3 stars, I considered it to be 4 star quality (my son who lives in Florence agreed). The bed sheets ad towels are high quality and the rooms are impeccably clean (so clean in fact that they frown on taking coffe from the breakfast room to your room). Location is a short walk from the train station, and in the middle of the town center so all the major attractions are easily accessible. Breakfast is very good and plentful, and is served on the top floor in a bright sunny room. Although not inexpensive (nothing in Rome is inexpensive), it is a good value in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Gem”
Reviews.Author: Italia033
Reviews.Content: Yes. decent rooms, wonderful staff, and I will be back. I have stayed at the hotel with my husband, and another stay with my sister and son, and 2 friends. Each time it was a lovely experience, e specially for a solo person because you can safely walk to very good restaurants, be very close to the railroad station, the bus station, and be within walking distance to the Colliseum, the Vatican, and other top attractions. The br eakfast served on the roof is wonderful! I have stayed at kuxury hotels in Rome, like the Excelsior on Via Veneto, and for friendliness and comfort, the Columbia is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to explore Rome...”
Reviews.Author: SuZeeDee
Reviews.Content: Last time I went to Rome I stayed in a different hotel [see other reviews] and I must say that I MUCH preferred this one. Location - couldn't be better! Walking distance from the termini, within easy walking ofmost of the tourist attractions and shopping... Very close to metro for the Vatican. Price - very reasonable for Rome, and included a lovely breakfast Hotel - lovely rooms, nicely decorated, Ok bathroom, but did the job fine - clean and functional. a/c in the rooms. Lovely friendly staff. Overall, for what i wanted [a nice base from which to explore Rome, without breaking the bank] it was perfect! I will stay here again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HELENA_AIRLINES
Reviews.Content: A little bit late, but I only can say that our stay was excellent. Once per year I travel with my mother, to show her the nicest cities in Europe. Up to now, we've stayed at Wien, Venice, Paris, London and last October, Rome. It was very helpuf to see the reviews of tripadvisor. I travel along Europe many times because my job, and my experiences in Italy have been terrible: Small and dirty rooms, unhelpful staff are some examples. Hotel Columbia is completely different: The staff is very proffessional, don't hesitate to ask them whatever question you have about restaurants, coffees, attractions...You will see always a smile and you'll feel very welcome. In addition, the location is excellent, the breakfast is very good (mmmm the capuccino!), the outdoor terrasse was nice, clean room, clean bathroom, close to buses and metro....Definitively, and comparing quality vs price, the best hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oz_BigTravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews on this site and like so many others we were not disappointed. We were travelling with our two teenage sons (14 and 16) and had the two bedroom suite (the second room is upstairs). The rooms are small but we were out and about most of the day so this wasn't an issue. Breakfast was good, staff were very helpful and the location was great, especially since we took trains to Florence and Naples while we were in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jamesjbrennan
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel that is close to train station and metro (literally 2 or 3 blocks/5 minutes). Clean and safe hotel with multi-lingual staff. Our room (superior double) was medium/large with an additional spacious balcony (fantastic). Hotel has movie channels, which are a nice option at end of a long day of travel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful and Wonderful Surprises!”
Reviews.Author: mocha03
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel here based on the proximity to the railway station and all of the positive reviews online. I was happy to see that it was close enough to the station so that we could carry our luggage without the need for a taxi. The room was small but extremely clean, and we didn't spend much time in the room. Upon arrival the staff mentioned they had a surprise for us, and we were delighted to go to the roof and find a lovely note and a brand new bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. It was completely unexpected and such a lovely surprise upon entering Rome. The staff is extremely welcoming, knowledgeable, and polite--we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, Neat and Complete”
Reviews.Author: belledujournee
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean, comfortable and nicely furnished room. Very attentive and friendly staff. Good breakfast. Rooftop terrace not to be missed, a great place for a bottle of wine in the evening. Stroll the halls on all the floors to appreciate the fine collection of art.

Reviews.Title: “clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: goldiept
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are that the staff is tremendously helpful, there is a lovely rooftop garden and it is near the rail station. The downsides are that the rooms are very small (I think most Roman hotels have small rooms anyway) and it is quite a walk or a short subway ride to the main attractions. I would probably look for a different place to stay but have no major gripes about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convenient Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: COLUMBUSEssex
Reviews.Content: We sought a hotel convenient for most of the tourist attractions. The Columbia was better for this than expected being within 5 minuites walk of the terminal for mainline trains / underground / bus.This was also the starting point for "stop & go"bus tours of the city which give a better geographical feel of the whereabouts of the city monuments sights etc. Whilst small the hotel had a very friendly atmosphere and everyone on the staff could not have been more helpful-virtually all coping easily with English / pointing us towards nicer & less expensive restaurants/ aiding our self exploration with maps/directions/best routes. All in all no moans at all, solely praise.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jpm_8
Reviews.Content: We loved this small, but beautiful hotel in the eternal city Rome. The stuff is very, very nice and helpful with advices. The rooms were clean and individual designed with everything you needed. Breakfast is served on the fifth floor where you can also use the roof garden. Nice is a short break in the afternoon with tea and cake sitting in the sun. We enjoyed our stay and will definitley come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ollie75
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon at the Hotel Columbia and we thought it was a super hotel. The staff were excellent, really friendly and helpful. The hotel is really close the the metro and within walking distance of most sites. We only used the metro to go the the Vatican City which was really easy to use. The breakfast in the hotel was fine and can be eaten out on the roof top terrace if the weather is fine. It was also nice to have a glass of wine at the end of the day on the terrace. The hotel was really resonably priced for wine etc. I would definately recommend this hotel to any traveller, there are lots of nice places in the area for evening meals etc without having to walk miles at the end of a busy day. Ola & David Scotland

Reviews.Title: “'A Little Gem'”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterJilly
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome. We were so lucky to find Hotel Columbia on the Internet. Its location was ideal for our needs - near to the train/bus/metro stations. Our room was quiet, clean and well furnished. It was ready when we arrived mid-morning which was very pleasing as we had made a long rail journey. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the food was plentiful and included fruit juices, cereals, various types of bread, pastries, cheese and meats as well as fruit and cakes. We found the staff to be very polite and attentive. The reception staff were friendly and gave advice (in several languages) for visiting sites and with suggestions for places to eat in the evenings. The roof terrace provided an attractive place to eat breakfast or have an evening drink during the Summer months. The room rates were very reasonable considering the service we received. We would have no hesitation in returning to the Columbia - in fact we thought we had found 'a little gem'.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper-thin!”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCurly
Reviews.Content: We like many others chose this hotel from the Tripadvisor reviews, and it is very nice, but basic. Great location, close to the metro, and even walking from here to the Forum was fine. Lovely outside dining area and the breakfast was average; no fresh fruit and the juices were powdered! My only real moan was that the walls are paper-thin! We could hear every word next door were saying! Thank goodness that's all we heard!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient Hotel for First Timers in Rome”
Reviews.Author: aallen18
Reviews.Content: Based a good bit on reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to stay at Hotel Columbia because of it's location to the easier transportation methods, Metro and bus. The front desk staff was most helpful (& spoke fluent English)in suggesting how to best get around, some reasonable & good nearby restaurants. The room was an acceptable size -we had 2 twins. While it was on the street side, noise was minimal - if we go again, we would likely request away from street. Very neat & clean, staff all friendly. Breakfast continental style, but good and all you need for a quick start to the day's activities ahead. Weather permitting, the rooftop is perfect for a glass of wine before retiring. Will recommend Hotel Columbia without hesitation.....

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: plcape
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, The best part of stay is proximity to termini station. The hotel is slightly dated, needs to be updated, linens, carpet etc. The breakfast was average at best and the staff at the breakfast room was curt. front desk staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: WalesKerry
Reviews.Content: We as a party of 4 reserved two double rooms. The rooms were excellent. although not large, their was plenty of room, they were well decorated and furnished and very clean. The bathroom was very good with lots of little extras. The breakfast room and terrace were a delight and the food and staff excellent. During the day and evening this doubled as a bar. A lovely place to relax at the end of a busy day. The location was superb, within walking distance of the termini, where if you needed to you could access any transport to any area. The location of the hotel also meant you were within walking distance of all of Rome's attractions. We cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. Our 6 day stay was made perfect by the hotel and its friendly staff. When we return we will definately stay here. Nowhere else would do.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sound insulation!”
Reviews.Author: holmul
Reviews.Content: One thing really lets down this good hotel, that's the noise! We were pleased to be at the back of the hotel, however, that does not help with those thin walls! We could hear EVERYTHING our neighbours were doing, and I mean EVERYTHING!! Apart from that, everything was good, especially the staff. If you want a reasonable nights sleep, as you do if your walking around all day, you need to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Treats their guests like "stars"”
Reviews.Author: bandgirl08
Reviews.Content: From the people at the front desk to those serving you breakfast everyone at the Hotel Columbia is warm, friendly, and seeking to make your stay a delight. We stayed twice on our trip to Rome and then returning from Florence. Our bags were generously held for us on our trip out and the service on our return was just as pleasant as before. I was so amazed when the hotel provided us with a breakfast bag of goodies for our early trip to the airport! This hotel and its impecable service to its customers is a gem and I would stay again and again as well as recommend it to everyone. Sincerely, Toni Drake, New Mexico, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great value service in ROMA”
Reviews.Author: ozcats
Reviews.Content: Great value for money hotel close (walking distance) to Central Roma Termini Railway Station. Very helpful front desk staff with good English. Rooms are well set up with a good bathroom. The complimentary roof top garden breakfast has a wide selection to suit most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TheNewTaylors
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbia from 15-18th August. Was perfectly located a 5 minute walk away from the Termini Rail Station, so no need to get a taxi. We recommend landing at Fiumcino Airport as you get a shuttle train service directly to the Termini called the Leonardo Express. The service runs every 30 mins and the journey time is also 30 mins. Cost is 11 euros per person one way. If there are 4 people in your party, it seems like it works out a little cheaper per head getting a taxi from the airport into Rome. In this case its best landing at Ciampino Airport as its a little closer. The hotel is slightly to the east of the city, but the main sights are in easy reach. Colosseum is 10mins, Trevi, Spanish Steps and Pantheon 20mins, Vatican City 30mins. All of these attractions are highly recommended. If this sounds like too much walking you can book a tour bus at 25 euros per head for two days. There are a few companies which you can find easily outside the Termini. You can hop on and off at any time and we didnt have to wait any longer than 15 minutes for a bus. This proved a saviour for my pregnant wife! The Colosseum and Vatican Museums have very long queues at peak times and we deemed it worthwhile paying extra for a guided tour which means you jump the queues. We didnt book in advance as these agents go up and down the queues regularly. Cost to enter Vatican Museum is 14 euros but we paid 45 euros for a guided tour. A bit steep maybe, but cut queuing down from 3 hours to half an hour. The Museum proved the highlight of the trip, so we could easily justify paying extra. Colosseum costs 11 euros, 21 euros with guided tour. As for the hotel, although not 5 star, is very clean and comfortable. Well stocked bathroom and minibar, plenty of storage space and flat screen TV. Breakfast buffet is served on the glorius roof terrace and was delicious. Staff are very friendly and were more than happy to carry luggage up to rooms, even though the lift was being refurbished during our stay(work had just finished on the lift by the time we left). I felt guilty as the ladies carrying the bags were half my size, but they still insisted on carrying them! Bless them, I felt so guilty, but is indicative of the high levels of service experienced during our stay. To summarise a very nice hotel in a very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its location and the reviews on this website. The rooms were a little small but very nice. The breakfast on the rooftop was great. Hotel staff was very helpful with all of our questions. We only had one day in Rome so we wanted somewhere that would be easy to get to and from the train station. This hotel did the job and more. We took a double decker bus tour so we could hit as much as possible in our one day. This was great because we got on right near the hotel and then we could get on and off at whatever sites we wanted to see. I would highly recommend this hotel. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandL_8
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this three-star hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the neighborhood and the hotel's amenities. Our room was spacious with a safe and flat-screen tv. Breakfasts on the shaded rooftop terrace were excellent served by a very pleasant staff. The desk was extremely helpful for all our needs. Before arriving, we were somewhat concerned about the location...given that it was close to the main train station. But one would never know that. The Rome opera was a block away and many restaurants within a few blocks. There were also some very fine museums and archaeological sites within a short walk, and the Via Nazionale, a major shopping street, is close by. If one wants a longer walk, the nearby Via Cavour can take one to other major sites.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel unfortunately only for one night, as we were leaving italy. We picked this hotel for its closeness to the termini train station and it turned out an excellent choice. The rooms are large, with chandelier as light source. The breakfast on the roof was excellent. I definitely recommend this hotel for anybody who goes to rome. It is very close to metro station and the area, though probably not 5 stars, looked very safe when we returned at night. do not hesitate to try it!

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: orchideespontanee
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel, rooms clean, spacious enough. Personnel very warm and friendly, ready to help at all hours. Fresh fruit would have been nice at breakfast, but otherwise the selection was more than adequate. a cup of cappucino with a sprinkle of cocoa in the morning at the roof terrace was THE way to start the day. In the evenings we had our lemon sodas there with the city buzzing below. Elevator was a nice extra after a day full of walking. Airconditioning worked just fine and it was definately needed when it was +30 degrees celsius outside. You can catch the metro, bus and trains nearby. I would definately encourage you to book your next stay in Rome at the Columbia hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Super Base to Tour Rome”
Reviews.Author: trailswest2
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbia was more than we hoped for - it was very clean, had friendly service and very accomodating. After an overnight flight we took the train from FCO to Termini and walked to the hotel. Be sure you get to the actual front of Termini and have a detailed map of Rome before you figure out where you are. We were a little disoriented for a few minutes and it added walk time to the hotel. The staff showed us our cute room, small but very clean and we were delighted - it was quiet for Rome and after resting for a few minutes we walked for 5 minutes to the subway station and then on to the Spanish steps. We used mass transit for 3 days with an unlimited BGI ticket for 11 Euro each.for subway and bus. The Columbia is so close to the train/bus and also a metro stop that we didn't use a taxi once. I had read reviews that the area close to Termini was questionable at night. We never felt uneasy and walked two evenings to a local restaurant nearby. The breakfast was very nice complete with a lovely terrace and great cappucino.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: 44Boppa
Reviews.Content: After a very long day of travel from Seattle, my wife and I arrived at the Rome train station (Termini) on a Friday night and walked the few blocks to this hotel, with two weeks worth of luggage. Front desk was very friendly. Room was small but had everything we needed. We told the desk clerk we would go across the street for a bite to eat, and she advised us to steer clear of that place as too expensive. She sent us half a block down the street to a restaurant with a rooftop garden where we had a lovely dinner and were treated like special friends when we told them the hotel sent us. In the morning, we were treated to a rooftop no-extra-charge buffet breakfast at Columbia that beats anything I have experienced at any hotel (short of the ones for which you pay $20 or more per person). We had a lovely selection of pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal and juices as well as coffee and tea. Upon checkout, we walked back to the Termini in five minutes to catch our train. I have nothing but praise for this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, wonderful for 4”
Reviews.Author: filisann
Reviews.Content: we were 4 women in our 60's sharing a quad. What a great find. the room was spacious and the bathroom well equipt and very clean. The breakfast room and terrace is fabulous. The staff is very helpful, but the staff in the bar and breakfast area are to be complimented. They have a lovely sitting area on the 5th floor. We all enjoyed our stay. It was very convenient to the train station and the metro. many from memphis

Reviews.Title: “WHEN IN ROME STAY AT THE HOTEL COLUMBIA... A HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: skagawa
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Columbia highly rated on Frommers.com and TripAdvisor and were exceedingly happy with our accommodations for our short two day stay in May. Rooms were very clean and staff very helpful and friendly. Katrin at the Hotel Columbia was there from the start, ready to lend a hand. She was considerate, communicative and such a pleasure to work with. Katrin even booked our tours of Rome as well as our private transfer to the hotel since we were arriving very late at 11:00 PM. This turned out to be a wise decision. We had everything in order before we arrived and were able to start our Rome tour right after our sumptuous breakfast among the lemon trees on the terrace. Breakfast was more than I imagined. They provided fruits, breads, cereals, juices, two types of tortes and cakes, cheese, meats, yogurt and more! YUM! Hotel Columbia is situated in a convenient location for touring. The tour company Katrin booked us on for our Vatican City tour was just a block away but they picked us up and dropped us back off in front of our hotel anyway. Just a few helpful hints: The Roman Colosseum is just a short 15 minute downhill walk, the Piazza della Republica a short 1 minute walk, and the Stazione Termini a short 3-5 minute walk. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps were about a 20 minute walk or about 6 Euros via cab ride. We just took the cab ride on the way back since it was an uphill walk. My husband and I so enjoyed the Hotel Columbia and its warm and inviting staff. We wished we could have stayed a bit longer in Rome but had to catch a cruise. We will surely be back to stay there longer when we return to Rome! It was like home away from home! Aloha from Hawaii! SK

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bettylou1987
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Staff went out of their way to immediately answer my numberous questions before arriving. Total hotel is spotless. Very nice breakfast, outside terrace is lovely. Only downside is the room was small but but adequate. You don't spend any time in the room anyway with so much to see. Location is perfect, 2 blocks from Metro and 4 from Termni station. Rome is very easy to navigate with public transportation. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Columbia an oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pog150
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Columbia Rome. We were two couples from Brighton England. We are professional people and the hotel was very suitable for our stay in Rome. The rooms were very tastefully decorated and all the small luxuries were in our room. A lot a attention to detail. The service was excellent and very friendly and the staff charming. We booked our vatican tour via the hotel and it was very good. The terrace with its bar was our little pre evening visit aperitif and our night cap finale. The breakfast was good and the hotel had hidden charms. We have booked it again for april 09. Fully reccommend this hotel, except when we visit as we want a guarantee of confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in a city since long!”
Reviews.Author: lowieHolland
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on the internet and read the reviews. Booked it and was not disappointed! Inside it's a very lovely Hotel especialy the suite we had with our teen kids. 2 bedrooms 2 flatscreens, 2 airco's and a staircase between the bedrooms. Nice breakfast on the roof terrace!. Close to public transport. If you want to walk: Colosseum is about 15 minutes. Trevi fountain about 20. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TonyBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We chose the Columbia because of all the positive reviews we found, both on Tripadvisor and elsewhere. We arrived on 09 April '08, our 25th wedding anniversary. All the good things we read came true for us. Just a couple blocks from Termini, the hotel location was perfect for us. Many bus lines, a big cab stand, and the Metropolitana were just steps away. And this place is *not* too far removed from the major tourist attractions. We walked either to or from the hotel to St. John Lateran, the Colosseo, S. Maria Maggiore, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain (not all in one day). It might be a hike, but if your feet are in a walking mood, you might even handle the trek over to St. Peter's. The staff was ever so friendly and accomodating...without being unctuous. I only regret that I missed the name of the lovely lady who staffed the breakfast buffet every morning. I think it might have been 'Sofia'. She spoke no English but had a multi-lingual smile and manner that charmed us both. My beginner's Italian filled the gaps. If... I mean when...we return to Rome we will certainly want to return to the Columbia. It's a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: andykelli
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome yesterday after a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Columbia. We had two rooms booked, both on the 3rd floor and both were very well appointed, one having an excellent view of via Viminale (double glazed windows blocked any street noise I'm glad to say). Breakfast was excellent, a very good selection and staff here were very attentive. Reception staff were very good too, offering restaurant recommendations and checking internet for events on our behalf. Top marks to 'Rome Shuttle Limousine' also for airport transfers! I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is so very central, close to the main station (for buses too, try the '110 OPEN' tourist bus) and the metro there and at 'Republica'. Good, cheap local restaurants too!

Reviews.Title: “Your Home in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: GiacomoMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbia is MY home in Rome. The staff is very friendly and accommodating: they recognize returning guests! The rooms are very clean, warm and quite elegant with crystal chandeliers from Murano. The buffet breakfast has a large selection of food: cereal, rolls and breads, coffee cakes, meats, cheeses, and hard boiled eggs, yogart, fruit and of course, coffee, milk and juices. The buffet is served on the fifth floor near the roof top garden, which is available for seating, anytime. The hotel will provide sandwiches and beverages, when one wants an afternoon light lunch or late evening snack. The staff is very helpful about directions to favorite Roman sites and are willing to give restaurant recommendations. The hotel is located near the Rome Opera House and near theTrain Station. It is especially convenient if one travels to other Italian cities. Do not judge the hotel by the small lobby and check-in desk; the Diletti family knows that the important comforts are the rooms and the buffet breakfast floor. I am willing to talk with anyone about my excellent experience at this hotel. I have stayed at this hotel four times , usually for four to five nights each trip since 2003. Ciao. Dr. James D'Aurora

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: robin7
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel because of its convenient location near Termini Train Station. Our family stayed in two rooms on the third floor and both rooms were clean and comfortable and the bathrooms were good but not new. The location is very quiet because Via Viminale is not a very busy street. Lots of great little restaurants all around this hotel within a few minutes walk. Some are very affordable for Rome. When you walk in the front door the hotel does not look very impressive. All the staff were super friendly and helpful, especially Katrin, who is from Germany. The breakfast room and patio on the fifth floor is very pleasant and light. Breakfast was good quality with some healthy choices. We found out later that they will also serve you coffee and drinks in the sitting area next to the breakfast room at any time. They have a computer there also where you can access the internet for a fee. Being near Termini is very convenient because you can get anywhere in Rome on the Metro from there, or take a train anywhere in Europe. Great experience, we sould stay there again. Robin from Houston, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - again!”
Reviews.Author: benstanley
Reviews.Content: I sent a small group there for the England vs Italy 6 nations match and all came back raving about the hotel Columbia. Rooms were clean, well serviced and recepetion was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Location was also spot on. We will book our groups there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: RussellP
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 5 day stay in Rome. The Columbia hotel is an excellent hotel to stay at. Location is near to the train station, about a 5 min walk. We used the hotel as a base to explore the city. We were able to walk to all the attractions, which made it easier to see all the sites on route. Other people we spoke to, staying in hotels outside the city, had to journey in & out every day, so a city hotel is recommended. Staff very friendly & helpful. Hotel clean & comfortable. Breakfast continental & lots of it. There is a down side. No tea or coffee making in rooms, no bar or resturant. Would recommend this hotel, Excellent price for a hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist friendly is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: slpinca
Reviews.Content: The hotel desk staff really made our stay in Rome great. They were friendly, helpful, personable and engaging. The hotel itself was clean with moderate rooms. We stayed in three different moderately priced hotels while in Rome and this was by far the best for the money. They treated you like family. Internet access and an ample breakfast was also a perk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Paul082
Reviews.Content: Our Anniversay in Rome was made all the more special by the friendliness of all the staff at the Columbia ( and free bubbly in the room). The high ranking on trip advisor is well justified if you measure the overall experience. Rooms are nice, including sky sports and sky news on good size TV's. Fruit and free safe also a nice touch Last piece of info already mentioned by other travellers and backed up by the hotel stall, DO NOT go to the Cafe /Bar on the corner of the other side of the road you will definitely get ripped off

Reviews.Title: “A good little hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: petercLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. would recommend it to others. Here are our comments Check in and staff very polite and very helpful. The room was slightly small but was perfect for exploring Rome. The hotel is close to the station and all bus tours and within 15 minutes walk of almost anywhere in Rome. Breakfast was plentiful and the hotel and rooms were very clean. The only complaint if any is the doors to the rooms are very thin and you can here other doors closing and the lift going up and down.........Not that we heard much after lovely foord and a bottle of vino!! As a whole excellent hotel for the price......a coin thrown into the trevi fountain means we will be returning.........

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: DonnafromPhilly
Reviews.Content: Frommers recommended this hotel and Trip Advisor has it ranked 30 out of 1150. They are both correct. The service was wonderful. The breakfeast that was included was at the roof top dinning room . It was very delicious with ample breads, yogurts, fruits and cereals along with meats and cheeses. We had stayed for 2 days. It is close to the Train Station and the tour buses stop 1/2 block away. The receptionist at the front desk are very helpful and spoke several languages. The rooms are cozy. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wonderful roof deck, great staff and price!”
Reviews.Author: lolabeans
Reviews.Content: Arrived from the airport and walked right to the hotel..very close to termini - which is great for taking trips via bus around rome. we were upgraded to a nicer room since we had told them it was out honeymoon (for no addt'l cost!). the hotel is one of those lovely old euorpean hotels with the little elevator (which is in the middle of the staircase and is see through, so you can see all the parts working - very cool!). We had a very nice room, not huge but bigger than most city hotel rooms. our bed was comfy, the room was really clean, we had a flat screen tv - and good channel selection. the dinner on the roof was great, your typicaly continental stuff but the roof deck made it really special. our stay was very affordable and the front desk staff was very accomodating. we would definitely stay at this hotel again! the lounge space on the top floor was very nice too. we definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stpdls
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ten minutes walk from the train station. Room was not very large but clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good on the terrace. Subway station was just around the corner. Teatro dell' Opera was on the same street a block away. I booked a ballet show and really enjoyed it. Also, I had tried the tasting menu of L’altro Mastai. Full of surprises. Highly recommended. Overall, a very good stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cypriotbird
Reviews.Content: First visit to Rome, hopefully not the last. Wonderful time, magical. Terrific hotel we couldn't fault it, very helpfull, friendly, clean and comfortable. Breakfast on the terrace every morning was a wonderful start to the day. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone. THANK YOU to all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: nininorfolk
Reviews.Content: What a great find. Near to the station and main attractions. Room was great, only one small problem, the plumbing in the adjoining room was noisy. Breakfast was excellent. Nothing was too much trouble. Reception staff were very friendly. Would certainly recommend this hotel. Only a 3 star but should be 4star.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: zachnnicksmom
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually STAY there, our parents did (and they told us it was phenominal), but our experience with them came when we contacted them about having a surprise (champagne, etc.)sent to our parents room for their anniversary. We were corresponding with them via email from the US to Italy. They were so very quick to help us, and they pulled the whole surprise off for us and helped make our parents experience there one they will never forget. They went WAY above and beyond our request by upgrading the room to one with a balcony view and they had a bottle of presseco waiting for them when they arrived and then a botle of champagne on their anniversary evening. Our parents described it as a "dream"! We would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone traveling in that area and looking for spectacular accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bragghouse
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in (204) was nicely decorated, very comfortable bed, with flat screen TV and fruit basket. Even though it faced the street it was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was very nice, especially the option of eating outside. The front desk staff was very helpful and made a great dinner recommendation. The location, 3 blocks from the train station and a block from the metro, couldn't have been easier to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel's i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Looby25
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is only rated a 3 star, it is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. The location is perfect for getting out and sightseeing, and you can get on the tour bus at the Termini, a 2 minute walk up the road from the hotel. The restaurant opposite the hotel didnt look much from the outside, but i found that the food and service there was excellent. However if you ask for a large drink, be warned that it comes in a 1 litre glass, and by accident i ended up with a litre of coca cola!! The hotel also offers a free a la carte pillow service where you have a selection of different pillows you can use for your stay, an excellent idea that i have never encountered anywhere else. I would recomend the hotel to anyone and im planning on going back in the next few months.

Reviews.Title: “About as good as you'll find in this price range in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: cityscaped
Reviews.Content: After the Albergo Cesari lost my reservation, I made reservations at this hotel, as it was within my price range. Despite being a five minute walk from the train station, the hotel feels completely safe; I felt comfortable walking around the area at night, and as there were two restaurants opposite the hotel that seemed to stay open until a bit past 12:30AM, there was still plenty of light and cover. The hotel felt more like a B&B to me; the room was not what I envision when I think 'hotel' (particularly at that price point), but it was more than adequate and acceptable. The furnishings put me a bit in mind of a friend's sister's bedroom, which was rather charming. There was, surprisingly, plenty of space in the room; the desk chair was rather uncomfortable, but as the TV was opposite the bed, I just used the bed as a couch. The bathroom was clean, if a bit small, but everything worked perfectly. Some say the shower's a bit small -- it's a standard shower cube, nothing more and nothing less, and perfectly easy to deal with. Housekeeping was quick and efficient, and they always restocked the shampoo and body wash (I believe I had three separate bottles at one point), which was much appreciated. The breakfast buffet is worth it -- no hot dishes, but plenty of other standards, and rather yummy. If you go early, before it gets too hot, the rooftop terrace makes for an enjoyable, relaxing way to start the day. However, the best thing about the hotel is the staff -- charming, professional, kind, friendly. They always welcomed you upon return, were prompt with requests, and genuinely a pleasure to deal with. Only downside to the hotel is the location -- close to the train station means far from most tourist sites. While the metro is close by, the Roman metro is an acquired taste -- scent, rather, and that may not be for everyone. That being said, it's possible to walk, but that's may not be an enjoyable experience in the summer heat. Overall, not a bad value for the money. I likely won't be returning to Rome, but if I were to, there's a good chance I'd stay here again. A truly amazing hotel experience in Rome is unlikely to come in at less than several hundred dollars a night, and the Hotel Columbia is a very good value for the price within this range.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alistair_Lodge
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed five fantastic days in Rome, and four wonderful nights at the Columbia. I will save my typing fingers and just wholeheartedly agree with all the positive comments posted on here. The hotel is outstanding and fully deserves its high position in the TA rankings. Watch out for the little waitress in the white shoes - She is an angel! Alistair and Penny Lodge Wakefield

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: mancunian01
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms as we stayed there as a family for five nights on our first ever trip to Rome, A lovely hotel - the management and staff were very friendly and accomodating- their personal recommendations for restaurants and bars were excellent. Listen to their tips! The rooms were kept very clean. The roof garden/terrace was a brilliant way to start the morning with breakfast served up there, we also met up there for pre-dinner drinks (alot cheaper than some bars located around the hotel!). Fairly close to all of Rome's major sights - but most taxi rides (when the feet got sore) were only about 5-7 euros, even to the Vatican city. Good location as well for the bus/train terminal - would always recommend this hotel as it is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ResidentinUK
Reviews.Content: We have recently had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Columbia, in August 2007. The hotel is situated very conveniently, about a 5 minute walk from the Termini Railway station, where there is also a connection to the Metro. The Republica metro is also about a 5 minute walk, and is less crowded and easier to negotiate than Termini. The Leonardo Express connects Fuminico Airport to Rome Termini station in about half an hour for 11 Euros. The hotels reception staff were always very welcoming and spoke good english and helped with local information about restaurants, shops, and local maps etc. There is a small lift which serves the 5 floors in the hotel. Our rooms were exceptionally clean and tidy, with excellent miad service, and had a well stocked bathroom. The air conditioning was brilliant. Breakfast was served on the lovely roof top terrace, which was shaded, and had lemon trees in tubs on it. The breakfast was a buffet style continental breakfast, with plenty of variety. The terrace was a lovely place to sit in the evening with a cold beer! (Very reasonably priced too). There was also a comfotable lounge area with sofas for relaxing in the evening. We didnt spend very long in the hotel as we were out sight seeing so much, but it was a lovely cool place to return to, in the mid-afternoon, to re-charge our batteries before going out again in the evening. There are a variety of local restaurants all serving reasonably priced good tasty meals in the locality. Thank you Hotel Columbia for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “a BIG SHOUT OUT to the wonderful Hotel Columbia”
Reviews.Author: MrsSol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbia from 20th to 23rd July 2007 for our first wedding anniversary. We boked our short break through Thomas Cook city breaks. After reading 100% excellent reviews about the Hotel Columbia, we chose to stay at this hotel and we can honestly say it was a great choice! We were a little worried about the area (only after reading various things on tripadvisor) but it was absolutely fine. We were greated by really friendly and courteous reception staff. Our room was lovely and clean. The roof terrace is a truely great place to enjoy a nice relaxing glass of wine in the evenings (or at any time of the day!). The bar staff on the terrace were very attentive. The receptionist staff were most helpful in giving advice on where to go, how to get there, booking taxi's, where to eat etc.. they truely made our holiday more enjoyable. As it was our 1st wedding anniversary, we were presented with a bottle of champagne and a card from the hotel by room service on the day of our anniversary! We were truely overwhelmed with this lovely gesture from the staff. The hotel is ideally located for the termini from where you can catch buses (we personally used the hop on, hop off buses which again you can catch at the termini). Failing that, the hotel is very central to walk to all major sites. Thank you Hotel Columbia, you were brilliant! and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hated it.”
Reviews.Author: ShellOb
Reviews.Content: We booked six months in advance and when we checked in they put us in a twin room on the second floor. As we had booked for a double, we requested to be moved to a double room. They were not happy about this but moved us as we had a paid for it and had the receipt. Good: - Located close to the metro Bad: - Paper thin walls. We could hear every movement from the 3 rooms around us. - Located in the dodgy part of Rome - Breakfast was awful. The worst we had in Europe. The ham was off, our cup of tea smelt like seafood (coffee machine obviously hadn't been cleaned in a very long time), milk was warm. - Shower was tiny

Reviews.Title: “The Columbia is a Sweet Surprise”
Reviews.Author: mulchmaster
Reviews.Content: For a first timer to Rome, I was a bit unsure of what to expect , both in amenities and in location . The Columbia was given good reviews but generally said to be in a tough locale. Well, I can tell you that being close to the train station, subway and great restaurants was truly a plus for our family. I found the area safe and fun. Located just down the street from the Opera House the neighborhood was just fine. No one should be deterred by comments about being near the train station (termini) The hotel itself , other than looking a bit dated on the outside was outstanding. All front desk clerks were very helpful to our family. The two bedroom suite we had was great. Plasma TVs, clean comfortable beds and nice bathrooms for Europe. The air conditioning was just fine. The rooftop terrace where breakfast was served was beautiful and inviting. Well kept. Since this hotel is owned by a Swiss Family, they do have a nice breakfast with assorted meats, cheese, croissant, cereal and of course expresso and cappacino. The old fashion elevator in the hotel is quaint and only adds to a great experience. Dont hesitate to stay here. We loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: thesteils
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbia on a three day city break to Rome. The hotel is in a central location and close to many of the attractions. Being away from the major roads it's very quiet which helps after a long day of sight seeing. The room wasn't huge but we had everything we needed and it was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff were great - friendly and helpful. The bathroom was nicely laid out in white. The roof top terrace is a great bonus for breakfast. I would happily go back to the Columbia and reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Peaceful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Briddy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel an excellent bargain in the center of Rome. The hotel is close enough to the train station to walk the few short blocks but is well situated near good restaurants and a laundry facility just a few blocks away. Our room slept 4 adults, was clean and the breakfast and morning view was superb. The staff was very helpful with locating areas on the map and when needed, calling us a cab which took a few seconds to arrive. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Henryscats
Reviews.Content: I came back last Monday from a long weekend with my boyfriend staying at the Hotel Columbia, which we booked purely based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed! The hotel doesn't look much from the outside, yes, the lift was small and the rooms weren't huge, but we had a great stay. We had all the facilities we needed - comfortable living space, air conditioning and a decent shower. The reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and gave recommendations for local restaurants, and the staff in the breakfast room/terrace bar were really friendly. The breakfast was a bonus - really set us up for the day. The rooftop terrace was lovely - what a start to the day! Also lovely for a nightcap before bed. The best thing, however, was the location - just about everything was within walking distance (took us about 20 minutes to walk to the Colosseum). A tip for anyone visiting for the first time - it's worth taking the hop-on/hop-off sightseeing bus to get your bearings. We didn't do this until the Sunday and were surprised at how close the other sights were to the hotel. If you're planning to visit the Vatican, get there as early in the morning as you can and make sure you're in the right queue! We arrived at about 10am on the Saturday morning, stood for 20 minutes in a fairly fast moving queue to discover it was for reserved tickets. We went to join the "ordinary" queue and, I kid you not, it went all round the outside of the Vatican walls - not short! Added to the fact that the weather was unseasonably hot (in the 90s every day!), we thought we were going to have to give it a miss. As luck would have it, we were approached by someone in St. Peter's Square who pointed us in the direction of an English speaking guided tour which was just starting - cost a bit more but at least we finally made it in! We barely scratched the surface of Rome during our visit and can't wait to go back again - it's a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KSJayhawk
Reviews.Content: We chose the Columbia based on reviews here in Tripadvisor and it lived up to the ratings. The location was great for getting to all of the sites either by walking or using the metro/busses. The breakfast on the roof terrace was a great way to start the day. Finally, the staff was wonderful, always willing to help or go the extra mile. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good value for the money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Best Value”
Reviews.Author: Maria0615
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbia was rated a best value in Frommers and they were absolutely right! The hotel was a great price (about 160USD a night), close to everything, people were nice & the rooms was so much more than expected. Let's just say a 3-star in Rome is nothing compared to a 3-star in the states. Breakfast was on the roofdeck and it was pretty good. They had a big selection of cereals, bread, pastries, american stuff like toast & bagels. I expected so much less. Location was great - near the Piazza Rebublica. Metro was around the corner so it was a quick trip everywhere (My husband hates walking or we could have walked from there). Quiet location and they had parking in front.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: lbeemerz4
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Columbia listed on TripAdvisor and couldn't be more happy! We stayed there for 3 nights (May 19-22). We were moved to a larger room the 2nd night, without even asking. The staff is so friendly and helpful with all our questions and requests. The "breakfast" was very good- and included in the cost! The lovely rooftop patio was a great place for a glass of wine in the evening. Also, the hotel is only 2 blocks from Termini Station, which makes it quite convenient. I would highly recommend this quaint little hotel to anyone with no hesitation. What a great find!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: monster28
Reviews.Content: Thank heavens for Trip Advisor. So many guide books steer you away from this area - we found it ideal - near the station and buses and with several decent cafes nearby. Was most delighted with the hotel staff - they made museum bookings for us (tip - book Villa Borghese before you leave on your trip) advised us on shops, eating out etc. All done with a smile. We complained about 'non-functioning' air conditioning on day 2 - someone came to our room with us immediately (and spotted that we hadn't shut the window correctly - hence no a/c) - they were charming (despite having already asked us whether we had shut the window). Room was really clean - bathroom much larger than expected. Generous breakfast on the roof every morning was a great start to the day. Have already recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Three times we have stayed and intend to return soon!”
Reviews.Author: Beaglemiller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel three times now. Each stay has been in August and for around one week each time. We are pleased with the ambiance, friendliness of staff (quite a few speak English), and the cleanliness. They provide a good continental breakfast, which can be eaten on a roof top terrace or indoors, if preferred. The rooms are simple but elegant. We love the venetian glass chandelier in our room. There is air conditioning, which is necessary in summer. Considering its position on a side street not far from Termini station it is quiet. Do not be put off by your first impression of the building, it is a typical roman hotel, and once through the door you are in a quiet, cool oasis. The Columbia is the perfect base for all sightseeing trips to Rome. The nearest restaurant is just across the road. The metro (just around the corner) and buses are easy to use especially with the passes, purchased from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbia two different times over a two week period for a 25th anniversary trip to Italy. It had come to us recommended by family members. It is quite convenient to the Termini (train) station, about a 7 minute walk. The train from the airport also arrives in this station, as do all the buses. The area is very busy and safe-feeling, even at night. Lots of restaurants and other tourist hotels; in fact, late in the afternoon the tour buses often held up traffic. There are at least two Internet cafes in the surrounding blocks, plus laundromats. The hotel itself has a lovely rooftop garden. open all hours, with a bar/coffee/drinks in the late afternoon and evening. The morning continental breakfast was the most complete we found in our two weeks in Italy, including meats, cheeses and hard boiled eggs. The staff is welcoming and helpful with directions. They called us a cab at 4 a.m. for our return trip and it arrived in three minutes. The rooms vary a bit in size, but we had doubles both times that were comfortable. The first room was on the fourth floor and side of the hotel, and we could leave our window open at night without too much noise. The second room was second floor, right over the main street, and was quite noisy with the window open, but no problem since the rooms have AC. The baths are sparkling clean, have the amenities mentioned by others. We had both a shower only and then the other bath had a tub/shower. Yes, the handtowels are like linens for a table, but the bath towels are large and terrycloth. This is par for the course in Europe. The wall mounted hairdryers are a bit different, but work well. The safe was much appreciated in both rooms. The lift is a hoot....two people, and feels a bit scarey, but truly an old-fashioned must-try. Stay at Hotel Columbia, and you will have what you need at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Columbia”
Reviews.Author: roncav
Reviews.Content: During my stay at Hotel Columbia, Rome, I became ill and required admission to hospital. The hotel staff were magnificent in terms of help and support to my wife and went "the extra mile" to ease her difficulties. When we return to Rome we will definitely stay at Hotel Columbia. The hotel is very clean and the room (including the bed) was comfortable. The roof terrace is beautiful and the breakfast probably the best we have enjoyed anywhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: winthorpe
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the hotel Columbia in Rome. It is a very welcoming hotel and our stay there was very comfortable. We had a large room with bathroom. There was an easy to use safe in the room which was useful. There was air conditioning which we did not use, as the weather although quite warm, was not hot enough to need the air conditioning unit on. There was a lift up to the fifth floor to the breakfast room and roof terrace, which was charming. Breakfast was very good. Fresh coffee or cappuccino,cereals, fruit and creamy yogurt, cakes, pastries, bread. A good continental breakfast. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is near termini (the main Rome railway station) and within easy walking distance even with suitcases. We felt that being near termini was very convenient for travelling around Rome on the buses and metro. We bought a three day roma card for the bus and the metro for 11 euro. There are other options available. They were bought from the newsagent in the station. We also did a lot of walking so a pair of comfortable walking shoes is essential. Rome is a wonderful city and not to be missed. It is also very crowded, so after a day of sightseeing it was good to be able to go back to a good hotel for a rest. There are plenty of places to eat all over the city for all budgets, the ice cream is a must. We had a wonderful few days in Rome and felt that the Columbia hotel near the Termini station was a very good choice for our stay. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: wpad
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my brother for 6 nights during easter. we chose the hotel after reading great reviews on tripadvisor and venere.com (we booked through venere, where you don't have to pay in advance) the hotel location is superb - about 2 blocks (2 minutes) from Termini station (the main train, bus and metro station), where you can get on both metro lines and all the major buses to sights (bus H to trastevere, bus 64 to piazza navona and campo dei fiori, etc. they leave every few minutes), and on the leonardo da vinci express to fiumicino airport. there is an even closer (1 block, 1 minute) metro line A station in piazza de la repubblica. although it is close to termini the neighborhood is quite safe even at night, the streets are full of people, and we had no problem walking around even with suitcases during the day (late a night most people recommended that we take a cab to termini so as not to seem like easy targets). very easy to get around rome even if you decide not to buy a bus map - there is a list of the bus stations on the busstop, and a screen on the bus detailing the next stops and the major attractions. the hotel staff was very helpful telling us which line to take where. the only thing is sometimes the hours they gave us weren't accurate, and it turned out the buses ran even later than they said (24:00-24:30 depending on the line), and there are night buses too. the hotel itself was lovely. not fancy but extremely well kept. rooms not as small as some people complain (we had room 308, non smoking with twin beds as we requested, they have doubles as well). the rooms are very sweetly decorated - chandalier, dried flower arrangements, lcd tv with cable (2 english speaking movie channels, german eurosport, cnn etc.). bed a bit on the hard side (but that's a matter of taste), and small compared to a US hotel (a double is truly a double and not queen size, and twin means exactly half of a double...) but no problem sleeping. the room is air conditioned. if you choose to sleep with the window open it can be a bit noisy (but still relatively quiet compared to other streets), but it is totally quiet if you close the window. the problem is the walls are very thin, so you can hear people in the adjacent rooms if they speak up (but i've been told that it's the same way in most rome hotels). from what i gathered from other reviews the quality of rooms differs so if what you get isn't satisfactory then try switching rooms. the bathroom was extremely clean (one of the cleanest i've ever seen, even compared to 5 star hotels), and you get amenities like toothbrush and paste, shampoo, shower cap, (i didn't expect that from a 2-3 star hotel). bath towels good. only problem is the hand towels aren't towels but cloths. no problem with the hot water at all (like i've read about other hotels) - plenty of it all day long. everything in the room worked just fine, including the safe. breakfast was great compared to rome hotels - not only croissant and coffee as some of the hotels, but a full diverse continental breakfat, with cold meats, cheese, variety of jams, cereal, yoghurt, breads and croissant, cake, canned fruit, hot drinks and juices. and you can choose to eat your breakfast outside on the roof terrace which is lovely. the breakfast was a bit less satisfying than usual on easter monday, because the bread wasn't fresh and the selection was a bit less than the other days, so keep that in mind if you intend to stay here during a national holiday. everyone on staff was helpful and pleasant. overall great service. the price was 168 euros/220 dollars per night - good value for rome (but of course you'll get a lot more for 220 dollars in many other cities in the world). rome hotels are incredibly expensive, so we were lucky to find a room in a good hotel for easter on a short notice for a reasonable price. had a great time, a lot to do with the fact that we had a nice room to return to every day.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: TBWashDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Columbia in April 2007. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and if you have the option to reserve a room with a terrace, I highly recommend. The rooms and view are quite quaint and peaceful. The breakfast each morning hit just the right spot to start each day. The breakfast terrace on the top floor offered beautiful views of the waking city and a soothing spot for a glass of wine at the end of the day. The staff spoke English and was extremely helpful with tourist tips and dinner recommendations and was always available if we had any requests. The hotel is located a short 5 minute walk from Rome’s main train station and metro stop. The area around the hotel was very nice and we felt very safe. The hotel also has a lift which came in handy with our large suitcases. Overall, Hotel Columbia was the perfect home away from home. – TB, Washington, D.C, USA.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boysieLlandudno
Reviews.Content: I must write to say what a great hotel the Columbia is. I've stayed in alot of hotels and this one has got to be in my top 3. The staff were great and very helpful. The food was also very good, and the rooms were very clean and tidy. All in all a great place to stay for the weekend or longer. Thank you again Roger Ballantine

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Patio to die for”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, although only 2 months apart with my family of 5. The hotel itself had wonderful character. Since i was a large family, we had two rooms both times. Two rooms had 2 floors, with a cast-iron twirled staircase. There were expensive Murano chandeliers and light fixtures throughout the rooms and the corridors. The beds are standard European sized, shorter and narrower -note, North Americans please do not expect North American sized beds! The bathrooms were newer and well maintained, but the towels are a disappointment. The service is quite nice and courteous, although when we arrived in the wee hours of the morning, we did find the doorman sleeping on the couch. The highlight of this hotel is the rooftop garden/patio. Its newer, well maintained, and great to see the buzz of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “8 great nights !”
Reviews.Author: MikeFrieri
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Hotel Columbia, but my 5th stay at a Diletti Family owned hotel in Rome. The staff is very helpfull and the rooms are clean and spacious. A full breaksfast is included in the daily rate and they make a great Cappuccino ! My wife and I highly recommend the Hotel Columbia ! !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: woolys
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome. October 2006 stayed 4 nights. Excellent hotel in an excellent location we walked everywhere. we hope to revisit Rome in the future and would not hesitate to come back to the Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Columbia”
Reviews.Author: PADinAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Hotel Columbia on the second floor last month. The hotel is convenient to the Termini station and Metro, with many shops and restaurants nearby.
