Traveling with 2 children, we booked a suite away from the elevator. We found the rooms very clean, with modern facilities - all in good working order. Plenty of 220v electrical outlets throughout the room, with one 110v "shaver outlet" in the bathroom. Our rooms were very quiet for a Rome hotel, with well-insulated windows. In room WiFi reception was good, though a little pricey at 3 euros per 30 min. The staff was most helpful and courteous through our online, pre-stay questions, through checkout. After our return, they promptly contacted us regarding a forgotten item. The breakfast was super, and the dining room staff very friendly. I would recommend the Hotel Columbia to anyone visiting the city in need of convenient, moderately-priced accommodations

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MoeMan
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here at the end of Sept 2006 for three days. The location was rather nice being only about a 1/4 mile from the train station. It's walking distance to many of the tourist attractions and there are ample good restaurants nearby. We were in Italy with another couple who stayed at the Westin (they used points for their stay and it was nice for a European hotel, but I can't imagine paying $600 per night). Anyway, back to the point - we found ourselves walking home around 1-2 in the morning on several nights and always felt safe so we disagreed with some opinions we read of this area being "seedy". The hotel itself is nothing spectacular. It's reasonably clean and maintained to an acceptable level. It did look as if carpet replacement time was rapidly approaching. Bedding was standard European issue - not terribly comfortable mattress, thin covers, flat pillows. Breakfast was also pretty standard for Europe... possibly a little better variety than some of the other hotels we stayed at. The staff was very friendly, accomodating, and helpful, which is the only thing that tipped the scales on this hotel to "above average". Overall, we both were satisfied with our choice to stay here, but agreed that we would take a chance on finding something better if we were to return.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Almedl
Reviews.Content: My wife & I and our 2 friends spent 5 days in Rome staying at the Hotel Columbia. The location was ideal for touring and the Hotel was excellent. The Rooms, Quality of fittings, Standard of Cleanliness were excellent. The inclusive breakfast gave a good choice of food and the staff who served were very attentive. The use of the roof garden for breakfast and later on for drinks was very pleasant. A problem we had was with someone who stole my wife's hand-bag but the hotel and local police force were very helpful in providing the necessary paper-work for our insurance company. We would all thoroughly recommend our friends to visit Rome and stay at the Hotel Columbia but be very careful about personal possessions when out touring. Fortunately the Hotel did have a safe in our room and we did not lose Passports, Tickets or Credit Cards. Alan Medland - England

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: aloupowell
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent i hear all kinds of horror stories from people and always look at tripadvisor as a guide, well this hotel was a dream, excellent location only 2 mins from the termini station, and 5 mins from the Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. The Colosseum, Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain are all with in easy reach, Upon arrival we were met by friendly staff who informed us that our room was just being finished off and would we like to go and have a drink on the roof terrace, which we did and 5 mins later our room was ready, according to italian standards our room was huge with twin beds and a sofa bed as well. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace and there was a good selection. Drinks on the terrace and from the mini bar were also reasonably priced. We were caught up in the problems with the airline security and the staff obliged in helping us find out flight information and bus details. they also helped in securing us dinner reservations and various day tours. Overall a wonderful experiance in a beautliful city, well worht the visit and i will recommend and hopefully return to the Columbia again.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: DerylDowling
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Rome and this was the best hotel we have stayed in Rome. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were very clean. Some rooms were a bit small. The postion was excellent only 200 meters to train station and to all public transport and walking distance to Trevi Fountain and many sights. Will stay again when we return. DERYL & FIONA DOWLING TASMANIA AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Hotel Columbia for our honeymoon, and all I can say is WOW what a lovely hotel. Clean, Friendly, Romantic, Quiet away from the hustle and bustle and heat - it was apsolute bliss.. I have read through a few comments on this site about the Hotel Columbia and I am confused why people did not like this hotel?!? I would recommend this hotel to anyone its in the right place surrounded by lovely places to eat, its not a hotel with a gym sauna swimming pool etc etc etc but it makes up for it in other ways Will be back there soonxx

Reviews.Title: “lovely, friendly, convenient and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: SalScotland
Reviews.Content: we would definitely return to the hotel columbia, although the area around Termini was not so perfect it was in fact very easy to get around Rome from and buses everywhere returned to Termini so no matter how far we walked it was easy to get back. The hotel was just right for our needs, clean and comfortable - the rooms though not overlarge were fine - and splendid chandalier! The unlimited air conditioning was wonderful and the roof terrace for breakfast and a late night drink was superb. The staff were all very helpful putting themselves out to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wot a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: An Intrepid Traveller
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a fabulous weekend in Rome. Stayed at the Hotel Columbia which is in a central location just around the corner from the Termini Station and was easy to find. Was a bit disappointed with the exterior as it looked a bit shoddy and was located on a grubby street but was very pleasantly surprised once inside. The Hotel Columbia is spotlessly clean and is well maintained, the staff are friendly and always eager to help. The rooms are tastefully decorated, we were very lucky to have the only room in th hotel with a terrace which was a great place to unwind after a hard days sightseeing. The roof terrace is the perfect place to start the day, breakfast was as expected with a selection of cereals, croissants, toast, cheese and juices. The terrace bar was open on an evening but we never had the time to go up for a drink. Overall I was very impressed with the Hotel Columbia and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, helpful staff. Beautiful roof deck & breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was great. Very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was the best we had in Italy this trip. They have both an indoor breakfast room and a lovely roof deck. Very close to both a Metro stop and the Termini train station. Extremely convenient. Room was TINY and the usual worn furnishings and linens.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: RonM53
Reviews.Content: As a party of four we stayed for six nights at the Hotel Columbia, booked through Venere. We found this to be an excellent hotel; both rooms were of adequate size, clean and well maintained as was the en-suite facilities. The staff were very friendly and most helpful on all matters. Breakfast was something to look forward to and there was always plenty on offer to set you up for the day. The rooftop terrace was also a bonus in Rome, especially on a nice evening and the bar prices were very reasonable for a city. A bottle of wine from the bar was cheaper than the off licence around the corner! This hotel is handy for the bus and train terminus for those with walking difficulties. Personally, we enjoyed a pleasant walk to most of the main sights and called in at many beautiful Basilicas en-route. There were many good restaurants in the area, but one to avoid is the rip-off "snacks" restaurant across the road (overpriced beer, poor food and 15% service charge), ask the staff for their recommendations. Our tour guide gave us the following advice on prices – use the price of the Margarita pizza on the menu as a guideline - 3 euros was reasonable, 5 euros was expensive and anything beyond was a rip-off. Don't expect any pizza in Rome to come up to the quality/quantity standards of your local pizza delivery in the UK - you won't find any - trust me!!! The staff will also book your taxi to the airport on the morning of your departure for a realistic fixed price, so no big fares or surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: cannylass61
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. You can get a bus from Ciampino airrport to the termi for 6 euros and the hotel is less that 5 minutes walk from there. The hotel was excellent and the staff were very helpful. We had a big room but a small bathroom, everything was spotless. Would definately stay there again if I was returning to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a break”
Reviews.Author: HC1812
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on the web and both myself and wife were extremely pleased with our choice. The hotel staff were accomodating, the room was ideal (quiet, clean and everything needed), the breakfast was great (lots of variety and superb coffee) and in addition they suggested a great trattoria just around the corner (Trattoria Abruzzese). We will come again - when we can escape the children - and we will stay again at this reasonably priced, comfortable and convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: doomdoom
Reviews.Content: for a mid price centrally located hotel you can't really fault Hotel Columbia. It's 2 minutes stroll from Termini, where you can pick up bus, metro or tour buses to virtually everywhere you want to go, or easy walk to most major sites. It's dead central but very quiet and peaceful, the staff are a delight - friendly, helpful, polite. Its not, itself, smack bang in one of the Tourist Spots, so its more Real Rome, local restaurants/shops are reasonable. The rooms do vary, so if you're not happy ask to see a different one. Ours was on the small side, but v. peaceful with lovely balcony and all mod cons so we were content. OK, the bathroom door handle was loose, but that was such a minor complaint against an otherwise perfect hotel. Lovely roofgarden for breakfast or a quiet drink and no ripoff bar prices. Only other slight reservation was the Tour Company they use (if you want to book a tour via the hotel) is distinctly dodgy. If using Green Line Tours absolutely check you know what you're signing up for. deborah Devon UK

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome where we stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Columbia on Via del Viminale, close to the central railway and bus station. It is only 5 minutes walk from the drop off and pick up point for the bus for Ciampino Airport and is in a good central location close to the Teatro dell'Opera and the Palazzo Massimo alle Terme. There are plenty of good restaurants in the surrounding area and the hotel receptionist was very helpful in suggesting where to go and not to go. The room was spotlessly clean with fresh towels and linen every day. It's not the fanciest hotel we have stayed in but has everything you need. The breakfast was excellent and is served on the roof terrace. Rome is a wonderful city to visit but watch out for the con men who drive around, pretending to be lost. They will call you over and ask for directions to wherever, then they spin you a yarn about their wife being the same nationality as you and that they are in Rome for a fashion conference. The outcome is that they will try to "borrow" money from you for petrol for their hire car! We were stopped twice in one morning by different men with the same story.

Reviews.Title: “staying for the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: twin1
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hotel Columbia in 2002 and we are going back in 2007. The hotel is a great place to stay. There were 35 people in our group and I didnt hear any complaints. The breakfast is a great start to the day. The staff is wonderful. They have an elevator for those who cant make the steps. The rooms are comfortable and were very clean when we were there. It is in walking distance to great food, and many things to see. We are staying there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling as a pilgrim/tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome at the Columbia”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. We were warmly welcomed on our arrival and the service was faultless throughout our stay. Room was very comfortable and clean and they accommodated our request for a room with a balcony. Breakfasts were above average with a good fresh selection each day. Hotel was in a perfect location for travelling by foot or by public transport with some excellent restaurants close by, including a particularly good chinese.

Reviews.Title: “very gpod hotel”
Reviews.Author: BARTSTAR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 05 for a week. The staff were really friendly, especially the lady in the breakfast room, who seems to be known as 'the lady in black and white' according to compliments left in the guest book ! The breakfast was served buffet style in a nice spacious room, plus there was a terrace which would be lovely in warmer weather. There was a large selection of fruit, cereal, pastries, cold meats and yogurts. The rooms were very clean and a decent enough size. Staff on reception are very pleasant and helpful, plus they speak English. The only slight downside to this hotel is its location close to Termini station. This is a rough area, so be careful when travelling home at night. Its not dangerous as long as you exercise the usual caution you should in any city, dont carry too much cash or cards(there is a safe in the hotel room) and put your hands visably over your bag to deter muggers. This is not to scare anyone, just a note to remember. You will find these areas in any city. The location also has many good points because both metro lines and all buses run to Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lesley M Chevin
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the interior of this hotel as it doesn't look much from the outside. The staff were very helpful, our room was a bit on the small side but big enough, and very clean and tidy. We were on the back of the hotel, so there was no noise from outside. There was the sound of water when toilets were flushed in rooms nearby, but that couldn't be heard if the bathroom door was shut. It's location is great as it's close to the train station as well as being within walking distance of all the major attractions of Rome. The breakfasts were brilliant with alot of choice. We would certainly use this one again
